name: SunsplashedSerenity walk to Harvard & Fresh Pond
description: An elegant, sun-splashed, 2 bedroom (+2offices) apartment with parking, a 20-minute walk or 7-minute bike ride to Harvard.  Enjoy this spacious 1st floor unit in a stylish 3-level house, with its gorgeous yard and two bluestone patios, on a quiet leafy street in Huron Village Cambridge.  Sleeps 5.
neighborhood_overview:
Huron Village is known for its charm. We have playgrounds, a reservoir, small artisans, a used bookstore, antiques, and two bakery-cafes all within walking distance of Harvard Square. You'll also find scrumptious take-out in several local places. (URL HIDDEN)
(URL HIDDEN)
host_about: I'm a professor at one of the local universities and a long-time Cambridge resident.  I live on the second floor at 64 Granville Road with my daughter.  We enjoy sharing our "Cambridge tips" with all of our visitors: where to ice-skate in winter or rent a canoe in summer, the best local places for cheese, bread, and yummy ethnic take-out treats.  We can lend you bikes and direct you to the Minuteman Bikeway, an 11-mile shady ride through Arlington, Lexington and Bedford, or give you a couple of sleds and show you the hill at Fresh Pond.  Whatever the season, we look forward to welcoming you when you're in Cambridge.

name: Lovely Studio Room: Available for long w/ends
description: Large sunny room w kitchenette & bath. Foam mat can be added for 3rd person. Must love rescue dogs; Callie is a gem; likes pets when you come and go. Quality queen mattress, fridge, microwave, good wifi, en-suite marble bath. Quiet, leafy Cambridge neighborhood, moments from city life. Walk, bike or bus to Harvard, Tufts, MIT, Lesley . **Must like kids, adorable ones live above & you will hear their footsteps at times. Covid Vaccination. No lock on room or use of other rooms.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and friendly and our street is tree-lined, and known as one of the nicest blocks in what is a great neighborhood. It's far enough away from the main street so you won't hear any noise, yet within moments you can be at the subway or in Davis or Porter Squares. there's a sweet playground nearby, a bike trail extending 19 miles, and many parks. A Whole Foods and Trader Joe's are both within a 15 minute walk.
host_about: Friendly, politically progressive, resourceful... I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the area well for a native NY'er. You will find the environment 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as one  guest from put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

name: Cambridge Getaway @ Harvard & MIT
description: Charming 2-bedroom apartment on the third floor of our beautiful Victorian home.
neighborhood_overview: Annmarie and I have lived in this area for over 50 years. We both live on the first floor of this house and know where people want to go. We can suggest the best restaurants and attractions in the neighborhood.
host_about: Annmarie and I were both born here in Cambridge. We have lived in the same location our entire lives. It is a wonderful area for visiting the city..We started with Airbnb for 4 years now and it has been a wonderfull experience. Many people have stayed here from all over the world.. Marathons, Graduations, Reunions and Family get togethers. We are surrounded by Great restaurant's and cafe's.. We are 5 minutes to bus lines and the Redline. You can walk to Harvard or MIT in 10-15 minutes Walkability has a 95% rating. We also have free parking.

name: HARVARD MIT STANDALONE CARRIAGE HOUSE LOFT!
description: Standalone private artist's carriage house loft. Our live/work funky artist's carriage house is located on historic tree lined Bigelow Street smack in the middle of Harvard and MIT! Absolutely central to everything! Redline T is 2 short blocks away. Mass. ave bus and Hubway Bike spot is at the bottom of our street. Easy Ubers, Lyft and taxi's everywhere. And fabulous coffee shops, restaurants, Whole Foods market, pubs, bookstores, music, Harvard, MIT, and HBS within minutes!
neighborhood_overview: Private standalone carriage house artists loft.  Walking distance to Harvard, MIT and HBS. Transportation including Redline T, bus and Hubway bikes steps away! Fantastic Parks, Restaurants, Pubs, Music, Whole Foods, Starbucks & Local Coffee Shops, Bookstores! Uber, Lyft, SAFR, and Taxis in abundance.
host_about: We are a household of writers, Illustrators, animators, filmmakers, musicians, technologists, immersive storytellers, visual narrative artists, professors and entrepreneurs…

name: East Cambridge Apartment
description: Our four bedroom home is tucked away in a wonderful neighborhood in East Cambridge.  Walk to great neighborhood restaurants and enjoy day trips to Boston with easy access to bus and train lines.  Enjoy the backyard and charm of Cambridge.
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is tucked away behind MIT and Kendall Square.  East Cambridge still has a strong Portuguese population that is apparent with grape vines surrounding our yard.  Our oldest son goes to school down the street and we love the community and our neighborhood.
host_about:
My wife and I are teachers north of Boston and have 4 children.  We enjoy traveling, being active, and spending time in Cape Cod and Lake Ontario.
  
As a family we enjoy seeing different places and experiencing different cultures.  We love the concept of Airbnb and as a young family, we love the idea of living somewhere else and having the flexibility/comforts of a kitchen and yard.

name: Quiet, Artistically Decorated Cambridge Apartment
neighborhood_overview: Our street is a beautiful quiet tree lined street that does not get a lot of car traffic since it is not a through street from major roads.  There are several parks close by- a large one that is great for jogging, soccer, softball, track and smaller ones that with newly renovated playground equipment and water features for hot days.
host_about: I have lived in this house for almost 30 years and have renovated almost every square inch of it.  I have two daughters who have graduated college (Colorado College & Princeton) and a son who graduated from Harvard College in 2022.  I love cycling, rowing, walks, yoga, cooking, making art and hanging out with family and friends.

name: See Yourself in Central Square
host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

name: Home on quiet street near Harvard
description:
Bedroom with double bed, desk, closet, wi-fi, and two windows. Bathroom for guest(s) only. Kitchen has breakfast supplies and storage space for guest(s) but also used by owner and occasionally family members.
Minimum of three nights booking reservations.
host_about:
I have lived in my house in Cambridge for more than forty years, during which I have shared the space with family and first-floor tenants. Though my children are grown, I love my neighborhood and appreciate the sense of community.  I know well the advantages of this location, and I always enjoy connecting people with historic and cultural resources. In keeping with these enthusiasms, I volunteer as a guide at deCordova Sculpture Park and Museum in Lincoln and participate in projects at a community art center near my house.  I post about art in the Boston area on a blog called ART OUTDOORS. 
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

Currently a freelance writer and editor of educational materials, I keep a home office but still have one guest room that is not used often enough.  I think the room would prove to be a comfortable base for someone attending a conference or exploring the Boston area. 
I am vaccinated and boosted and try to follow whatever masking, testing, and cleaning guidelines are current.

name: Cozy Mid-Cambridge Charmer
description: - Enjoy the comfort & convenience of my cozy 1 bedroom, on a quiet street in Mid Cambridge. With lots of light, hardwood floors, french doors, a beautiful kitchen & 2 decks. Minutes to Harvard, MIT & public transportation. Minimum stay is 4 weeks. No parking.
neighborhood_overview: Mid- Cambridge is a beautiful neighborhood of Victorian houses and tree lined streets.   Convenient to everything - half way btween Harvard & Central Sqs. Enjoy excellent dining, entertainment, site seeing & seasonal events. Everything you need is near by including grocery stores, library, post office, drug stores, cafes, banks, hubway bikes, Charles River.
host_about: Hi, I am Melissa. I grew up in historic Lexington Mass and studied Art History and Art Education. I make sculpture out of recycled computer parts out of a Maker Space called the Artisan's Asylum in Somerville and teach people of all ages. I put my heart and soul into renovating my condo and turned it into the dream home I always wanted! I love the back porch and back yard. It is the most relaxing place to hang out on a hot summer day! I rent to Harvard and MIT affiliates. Many international scholars have stayed in my condo.  Come visit MA. I live around the block and would be happy to give suggestions of what to see and do on your visit!

name: Harvard/MIT/BU/Central Square Room
description:
The Room includes a Bed, Desk, closet, remote overhead dimming light, and Air conditioner.

The apartment is a 3 bedroom 1 bath on the second and third floor of a 2 family house.

When more than one guest is present, the bathroom is cleaned weekly, and the entire house is cleaned every other week.

A bike with a helmet and lock is available during your stay.

This listing is for one of the 2 rooms in the photos, not both.
host_about:
I'm a software dev who has lived in Cambridge for many years & love all my town offers

Happy to offer local recommendations:
bike trails, kayaking & other outdoor activities (especially nature outings — the Charles River is 3 blocks away!), whale watching, comedy, museums, cultural events

You're also welcome to use my fleet of renovated bikes for exploring, free of charge

I’m always reachable for anything that will make your stay comfortable

neighborhood_overview: What is not to love about Inman Square!! Tons of Restaurants and still maintaining a neighborhood feel. There are 2 WholeFoods Markets within a 10 minute walk.
host_about:
I am married and a mom to two amazing children and an Airbnb host since 2012. I was the Chef/Owner of two award winning restaurants in Boston prior to having children. My husband Chad is an Engineer. 

 Cambridge has been our home for over 20 years and is an amazing place to live and raise a family.

I DO require all guests are up-to-date with their COVID boosters.

Quiet room w/ futon and couch, desk (not a work desk) , and closet.

Bus to Harvard Square leaves just around the corner. It's about a 10 to 14 minute ride depending on the time of day, and there is a subway connection there.There is also a subway stop about a 13 minute walk from my place.

I have a lot of hosting experience and can provide good tips based on an individual's interests.
neighborhood_overview: This was the working class neighborhood of Cambridge, the area where former speaker of the house, Tip O'Neil, grew up. A lot of condos have gone up in the neighborhood. It's an area that borders Arlington and Somerville, and Belmont and Watertown are also very close.
host_about:

name: Minutes to Harvard Square
description: This is a newly-updated well-maintained 2 bedroom condo unit in a classic Cambridgian triple decker house setting. We are located on the first floor (or 'ground floor' in European terms).  There is a separate front entrance to our unit.  The condo is located in Strawberry Hill, the quietest and safest residential neighborhood in Cambridge, 1.5 miles west of Harvard Square. Away from subway metro stops but accessible to the station with four frequent bus lines. Great amenities by foot.
neighborhood_overview: very quiet and family oriented. Free street parking directly in front of the house. Walkable to public library, playgrounds, supermarkets, restaurants and outdoor tennis/golf/running trails. Car rental within 1 mile.
host_about: I live between two coasts. I love to travel, and I'm quite easy going.  I've spent my formative years in various continents, experienced to various cultures.

name: Victorian Charm MIT/Hrvd/ CentralSq, private deck
description: Welcome to our 100-year-old house! Cozy, friendly and full of charm. Very convenient to MGH, MIT & Harvard. Our location is hard to beat: close to both subway and bus with many excellent restaurants in walking distance. Located in Central Square, we are also an easy walk to Kendall and Inman Squares. For runners and walkers, the Charles River paths are 0.5 mile away. This unit features hardwood floors and nine foot ceilings. The private back deck is very popular.
neighborhood_overview:
Despite our urban setting, our neighborhood is very quiet, particularly at bedtime. It has always been the kind of neighborhood where women can walk alone safely at night. Generally speaking, this side of the river is dramatically calmer than the Boston side though now bustling with a nice variety of great restaurants.

We actively recycle. There is a blue bin in the unit. Or, we can do it for you if you simply keep glass, plastic and metal trash together and separated from trash. We also keep a compost container in the fridge for vegetable trash. We'll empty it into the big bin outside when you leave.
host_about:
We are a pair of classical musicians in Cambridge, located between MIT & Harvard. As with much of Cambridge, we're hopeless lefties. 

On parle un peu de français. Hablamos poco español. Und ein bisschen Deutsch auch.

Most Sundays you'll find us "making a joyful noise" at one church or another.
We've been in this old house and this neighborhood over 20 years now. Since we cook a bit, the rental floor fridge and pantry might contain a little overflow from ours. We're huge fans of Airbnb both as guests and as hosts. Leave your towels and sheets at home; we provide all that for you. Our biggest challenge as Airbnb hosts is saying goodbye to the awesome people who stay with us.

name: Cambridge Apt, walk to MIT, Harvard
description: Private, sunny, top floor and a half of owner-occupied 19th century row house. The house is tucked away on a private lane minutes from Central Square and public transportation (subway and bus), restaurants, pubs, and two grocery stores. name: Renovated Brownstone - MIT/Kendall Square
description:
Cozy private room and bath in a renovated brownstone in East Cambridge. GREAT LOCATION! Near MIT, MGH, Charles River with easy access to everything Boston and Cambridge have to offer.

For our safety and that of our guests, we can only accept requests from fully COVID vaccinated guests. Please confirm this when booking. Also, please provide us with some information about the purpose of trip and your travel plans. This helps us better meet your needs. Thanks in advance!
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!

If you are going to visit Boston and Cambridge, this is the place to stay. I am located in East Cambridge - near Kendall Square, MIT, Harvard, Massachusetts General Hospital, and Boston - with easy access to everything Boston and Cambridge have to offer. The Museum of Science, the Galeria Mall, and the Charles River are a short 3-5 block walk and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.
host_about:
I have been hosting with Airbnb in my home since 2013 and am delighted to be back in business after our year of a COVID hiatus. Having received my second COVID vaccine, I am beginning to see a light at the end of this tunnel. I hope you are doing well and ready to travel again. New England is a great place to visit so I look forward to meeting you soon!

A little bit about me…
Originally from Florida, I found my way to New England via Spain where I lived and worked for 10 years! I have resided in Cambridge for the past 16 years and love everything it has to offer. I know the city well and can give you tips on things to do, places to see, and where to eat! 

My partner, Steve, and I are both retired from the education field. I was a Spanish teacher and he retired as a library director. We love to travel, cook, and spend time with friends and family.  

Hope you will plan to visit, we would love to host you.

Safe neighborhood with convenient transportation, dining and shopping.

Tastefully decorated apartment on tree-lined street just outside Inman Square in Cambridge.
Located conveniently near the Cambridge Public Library, Harvard, MIT and many restaurants/cafes.
15 minute walk to Harvard and Central Square (redline).
neighborhood_overview: Just outside Inman Square in a safe and tree-lined neighborhood, we are in walking distance to a number of great restaurants and cafes, independent grocery shops (and two Whole Foods), the beautiful Main Branch of the Cambridge Public Library, two pharmacies, a hospital, parks and playgrounds.

name: Guesthouse (Rear)
description: This ample bedroom is on the first floor and is a comfortable space. The kitchen and bath are shared. All utilities and wi-fi, cable tv, and linens included. Minimum stay: 31 nights. Located in a first floor apartment that doubles as a small urban retreat center. Open to all ages, creeds, and colors, and rainbow friendly. We have a meditation room and weekly potluck suppers which our guests are invited to.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is residential yet quite vibrant and has many services within walking distance. Two blocks in one direction is the wonderful café Sofra with homemade confections and middle eastern dishes. One block in the other direction is Shangri-La: an excellent Chinese restaurant. Two blocks away is Greg's, a neighborhood Italian eatery with full bar and early bird specials. Also within a block are a well stocked liquor store/wine shop, a middle eastern bakery, and a dry cleaners. If you want to walk five blocks to Coolidge Square there is a tasty vegetarian restaurant (Red Lentil), a great diner (Town Diner), a tiny but very good middle eastern eatery (Jasmine), and a super coffee/lunch spot (Uncommon Grounds). A supermarket (Shaws) is four blocks away. A jogging trail around Fresh Pond is six blocks away as is a very nice nine hole golf course. All of this only a ten minute bus ride from Harvard Square!
host_about: I am a long time Cambridge resident having come here originally to attend Harvard Divinity School. I'm a residential real estate agent practicing in Cambridge and Boston. I co-own a three-family residence in Fresh Pond Cambridge and rent out two rooms and a studio through airbnb at my residence where I also reside. I'm interested in health and help run a small meditation and holistic health group out of the first floor apartment in addition to the room rentals. My interests also include gardening, interior design, travel golf, and of course hosting on airbnb! I like providing beautiful and comfortable spaces for my guests to enjoy. I own an RV and love to go camping to the mountains and seashore with my friends and especially my grandchildren. My favorite travel destinations are New Orleans, Savannah, Georgia, and Palm Springs California. I like all kinds of foods and especially my veggies, and I'll give you my cole slaw recipe; grate a cabbage and some carrots, add a grated fresh anise and an apple to the mix, then add some organic cider vinegar and olive oil mayo to taste (this mix tastes so good, you can try it without mayo). My musical tastes are also wide and include jazz, pop, and a cappela.

name: Bright Convenient Apt Harvard / MIT
description:
This 600 sf apt with roof deck on the third floor of an old Victorian home is bright and airy. Surrounded trees it does become a sanctuary, a place to call "home". Centrally located and within walking distance to MIT, Novartis, Harvard. It is within minutes walk to the Central Sq subway, station.

The apartment is efficiently laid out with a loft feel. It has a bedroom with king size bed, bath, kitchen, and living area with a ligne roset pullout couch/bed, plus a 230 feet deck.
neighborhood_overview:
In Central Square, easy access to lots of restaurants and bars. walking distance to Inman Square, Kendall Sq, Harvard Sq. Minutes to downtown on the subway. Easy access to zip cars and hubway bicycle service. There are three grocery stores within 5 minutes, Whole Foods, H-Mart and Harvest Coop.

There are a few drinking places; the Fields, Phoenix Landing, the Druid (Inman Sq) and Plough and Stars. They all serve food.

Restaurants are also abundant. It has a concentration of ethnic restaurants. For Indian, Central Square has Shalimar, India Pavilion and many others. There is Central Kitchen, Viale, Oleana, Ole, Casa Portugal, Dumpling House (Chinese) and Four Burgers. Flour is a short walk toward MIT and is known for its baked good and breakfast.

name: Charming Victorian Home Near Harvard Square
description:
Welcome to our charming Victorian home!
- 1900 sq ft with stunning vaulted ceilings
- Relaxing deck and beautifully landscaped garden
- Big screen TV and comfortable seating
- Free off-street parking available
- Steps from the 'T' to Harvard Square
- Close to MIT, Harvard, and local attractions
- Explore Harvard University, the Harvard Museum of Natural History, and more!
Sometimes we can offer free off street parking, no car needed however.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled up to Harvard and surrounds the neighborhood is quiet, well established, and beautiful with a lot of history and many famous residents past and current.

Located in the neighborhood of Cambridge called Huron Village, the home is blocks away from the historic Longfellow house, Harvard, Radcliff, Leslie and the entire area exudes Victorian charm.

There is easy and quick access to local stores, tree lines streets, and it offers exceptionally easy access to all things Cambridge and Boston, no car required!
host_about:
I love anything with a story behind it.

In Phoenix, we offer a perfect sanctuary near the city's attractions.

In Cambridge/Boston, we care for a 124-year-old Victorian with New England charm, preserving its classic features and greening where possible. 

We share these homes, using earnings to renovate further. We hope you love them as much as we do!

We also help owners share their special homes with others.

name: Haven in Cambridge (entire place!)
description:
My place is in a residential building and a great neighborhood. It's across from a large park, library, bicycle rental, is walking distance to transit, restaurants, the Charles River, and MIT. Relax on the couch or cook in a beautiful kitchen. It's your time away! :)

Please note that there is no elevator, no television, and no microwave.

This is my home and I have an exemption that does not allow service animals or emotional support animals. Thank you for understanding.

name: 2 Bedroom FULL Flat in Harvard MIT w/ KING Bed
description:
Pls do not place booking request 'Contact Host 1st

UPDATES FULL WOODEN FLOOR 2-bedroom apartment steps away from Harvard University & MIT in the heart of Harvard Square. Tastefully decorated unit is perfect for light sleepers & features study desks in each room. The Red Line station is nearby for easy transportation. MESSAGE US before booking to ensure personalized experience during your stay. Enjoy all that Harvard Square has to offer, including restaurants, shops & cultural attractions.
neighborhood_overview:
Discover the best of Cambridge from this prime location. Just a 3-minute stroll to Harvard Square and a 10-minute walk to Central Square Station, you'll have easy access to the rest of the city. Enjoy great coffee shops, top-rated restaurants and bars, and explore the city's vibrant cultural scene.

Other nearby attractions include the magnificent Cambridge Public Library and its beautiful park, just half a block away. For your convenience, a full grocery store and drug stores are only a 3-minute walk away.

Getting around is a breeze, with all major bus stops and the Harvard Square Red Line just minutes away. Whether you're here to be part of the Harvard community or heading to Boston, this unbeatable location puts it all within reach.
host_about:
Human first. Herd being. Lover of community.

Harvard affiliate. Design enthusiast. Longtime Boston/Cambridge resident—by way of the West Coast, the Midwest, and now here. Born and raised in a world-famous country (ask me which one!).

Large bedroom + FULL PRIVATE bathroom, situated on a separate level of a townhouse in the heart of Cambridge (Central Sq.). Within walking distance of both Harvard & MIT campuses, as well as numerous bars, restaurants & groceries. Ideal for those on the go who desire a prime location, quality, safe & quiet to rest at night!

neighborhood_overview: If you have never been to the Boston area before, Central Square is a prime location between Harvard & MIT in the heart of Cambridge. The neighborhood is relaxed and friendly with an international flair.We are within walking distance of Central, Harvard, Inman and Kendall Squares, with their many fine restaurants and theaters, music and sports venues.
host_about: Hello! My name is Nan and my partner's name is Therman. We've lived in Cambridge for years, and in the Boston area for way longer than that, so we can answer most questions you may have about how to get from here to there and what there is to see and do in this beautiful city. Currently, by trade we are used book merchants, although our pasts include many great adventures ranging from musician to milk man! We look forward to meeting you and hope you enjoy your stay in Cambridge.

name: Sunny 3 Bdr corner luxury apartment
description: This sunny corner apartment in a modern building houses 6 comfortably. Two rooms have queen murphy bed/sofas,  and the last a twin daybed and trundle bed.   A short walk from Central Square, MIT and Harvard.    Enjoy gourmet kitchen and dining area.
neighborhood_overview: Beside being close to MIT and Harvard along with Central, Kendall and Inman Squares, our building is next to nationally-acclaimed restaurants Bondir (right next door) and Oleana (a block away).   A new coffee shop/craft beer shop (Lamplighter) just opened across the street.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: 5BR Home in Cambridge
description:
Great home for families our large groups with off street parking and easy access to public transit.

Dogs allowed for an additional $50 per day fee (2 dogs max). Please mention in your request if you are bringing a dog. No cats due to allergies.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a quieter section of Cambridge.  Fresh Pond Reservation across the street has a 2 mile path for walking or jogging and many wooded areas to explore.  There are several great playgrounds within a short walk, and an assortment of small shops less than half a mile away in Huron Village, including a toy store, a grocery store, and a couple restaurants.  We live 1.5 miles from Harvard Square.  It is a very nice walk there, a 10 minute bus trip, or a $6-8 Uber ride.  Note that we do live on a busy road and traffic noise can be heard inside the house.  When windows are closed, it is barely noticeable.
host_about: We love to travel internationally with our four children and make our home available to other travelers while we are away.

name: Harvard & MIT- Sweet Retreat in Coolest Cambridge!
description:
Our Sweet Retreat is quietly hidden away in the heart of Cambridge, steps from a cafe, bike sharing, MBTA, Harvard, MIT, shops, and eateries — as well as equidistant to Harvard, Inman, and Central Squares. The apartment is comfortably furnished and INCLUDES off street PARKING!

We will greet you and point you to the historical, artsy, free, outdoors, music, restaurants, beaches, and etc. As friendly, long time Cambridge residents (designers and world travelers!), we know the hidden gems too.
neighborhood_overview: This is an old neighborhood of owner occupied homes once used as servants' quarters for the Brattle Street mansions near Harvard Square in the old, Victorian days. We neighbors all know each other, so things run smoothly. It is safe, quiet, friendly, and has GREAT coffee steps away.
host_about: Artist, textile/accessories designer, and global traveler with a particular love for Asian markets, vintage textiles, and artisans !! My daughter and I lived in Vietnam for the better part of 7 years, and our home is definitely a mini gallery of our travels. I am positive you will feel very happy to be in the midst of lovely colors, interesting books, and, best of all, in a seemingly quiet corner of Cambridge, tucked away, that in actuality — is in the center of all!

description: Take advantage our private, cozy Cambridge home. It is minutes from Harvard Sq. and Boston. Its close proximity to Fresh Pond is a bonus. Our friendly, Strawberry Hill neighborhood offers easy parking, great local eateries or a quiet night in. Dog friendly at no extra fee!
neighborhood_overview: Strawberry Hill is a very friendly neighborhood between Huron Ave and Mount Auburn Street. There are numerous little places by local owners offering a multitude of food within a ten minute walk.  All along Belmont Street one can find - Sofra ( a spinoff from Oleana) is a quick walk away; Eastern Lemejun has delicous Armenian & middle eastern offerings; Conleys Pub and sports bar is always serving up food and drinks; Homemade Greek yogurts and foods can be found at Sophia's on Belmont St, and just before that Linda's Donuts makes the best home made donuts from scratch every morning; Fiorellas has pizza and Italian; At Aram's Cafe, one can get a breakfast or lunch cooked by Aram himself, whose establishment has been cooking up delicious entrees for over 30 years; Moozies Ice cream for homemade ice cream and an outdoor movie screen in warm weather. There is a large supermarket, liquor store and drug store in Star Market as well as local food shops. The Fresh Pond Golf Course and Waterwork
host_about: I am an artist, cook, gardener, mom and teacher. I love to bike around FreshPond, kayak on the Charles River, watch my children's sports games, head to Rhode Island (my hometown ) for the beach. I love the city and all it has to offer.

name: Garden-level one-bedroom apartment
description:
Sun-filled 650 sq ft apartment in urban oasis. Private entrance. Minutes from Davis Sq and Alewife Red Line T-stops. Free street parking with guest permit. Fridge, microwave, coffee maker. Full bath. Private patio. Check-in starts at 3 PM; check-out by 11 AM.

Access to the property is limited to registered guests. This spot is not suitable for entertaining, and third-party guests or visitors are not allowed.

Please read the entire listing & amenities pages and ask questions before booking.
host_about:
Started teaching at MIT over ten years ago and fell in love with Cambridge. My favorite things about the neighborhood are its outstanding restaurants (Gran Gusto, Life Alive, Sarma...), down-the-street access to the legendary Minuteman Bikeway, and its quiet, almost suburban atmosphere.

I love to make guests feel welcome and comfortable and to share the joys of Cambridge living.

name: Elegant contemporary 2Br
description: This two bedroom apartment in modern building sleeps up to 5.  Primary bedroom has a queen bed, and the second bedroom has a bunkbed (twin over full). A short walk from Central Square, MIT and Harvard.  Fully equipped kitchen with cookware, dinnerware, and everything needed to prepare a gourmet meal.
neighborhood_overview: Besides being close to MIT and Harvard along with Central, Kendall and Inman Squares, our building is next to nationally-acclaimed restaurants Bondir (right next door) and Oleana (a block away).
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Charming Third Floor Apartment
description: Third floor of lovely 19th century house, nicely landscaped and set back from the street. A private retreat ideally located in a quiet neighborhood between Harvard and Porter Square, close to  some of the best restaurants and shops in Cambridge, minutes from the Redline.  Sunny and spacious with two bedrooms and a separate food preparation/living and dining area.
neighborhood_overview: The area between Harvard and Porter Squares is one of the most lively and interesting parts of Cambridge, as is Davis Square which is also nearby. Temple Bar, Giulia, and numerous other great restaurants, takeout places and cafes are right around the corner. Abodeon, Pod, Nomad, and Joie de Vie plus the unusual vintage stores and music venues of Davis square are just a few of the interesting possibilities. The Peabody Museum with its exquisite glass flowers and the newly renovated Harvard Art Museums are within walking distance.

name: Furnished rm, Harvard/Porter Square
description: Near restaurants,  secluded 3rd fl. room in Cambridge w. sink, kettle, microwave & fridge. Bathroom  same floor, normally not shared.  Firm mattress. Single bed. Start your visit before 10 pm, no curfew thereafter. Please give estimated check-in time in your request to book the room.    Covid vaccination requested . Reduced rates for longer stays.
neighborhood_overview: Between Porter and Harvard Squares, and one block from Mass Ave, this is one of the most desirable areas in the Boston neighborhood. It is quiet, with restaurants within steps of our house.
host_about:
I have recently retired from Nutrition Matters, my own nutrition counseling business of the last eight years.  Before that, I worked for nearly forty years in the field of education.
Besides fifteen years in student affairs at the graduate level, I have taught Freshman English and English as a Second Language in Paris, conducted research in sociology, run an American junior year abroad program, and earned a doctorat 3e cycle from the École des Hautes Études en Sciences Sociales.
We welcome AirB&B guests from abroad as well as from the U.S.!

name: Sunny Huron Village Apt. w/ Terrace
description: Our two-family home in West Cambridge includes a new one bedroom apartment on first floor, with sunny bedroom, living room, new kitchen & bath, as well as a wonderful private garden terrace.  Easy commute to Harvard Sq on foot or by bus.  Excellent WiFi for working remotely.
neighborhood_overview: West Cambridge is a hot neighborhood at the moment, with great urban amenities and excellent green spaces. Nestled between the historic homes of Brattle St, the unique shops of Huron Village and the green spaces of Fresh Pond reservoir and Danehy Park, there's lots to do and see. Jog or walk the 2 mile loop around the Pond, explore historic neighborhoods and sample the many interesting food shops. Or wander down to Harvard Square and all the university has to offer with museums and bookstores galore. Major retailers like Whole Foods and Starbucks are also a short walk away.
host_about:
I have lived in Cambridge for over 25 years.  I moved here for graduate school at Harvard and never left.  Currently, I'm a baker and  pastry chef  ( Instagram:  @hazelnama ) working part time in local bakeries.   However, my primary job is raising our eleven year old son.

I love to travel and have been all over world (most of that before having a child).  My partner and I spend a good deal of time in Maine but are plotting trips much further out as our son gets a little older.  

As a host I'm very accessible but mostly hands off.  I'm more than happy to answer any questions, point you in the direction of great restaurants or sights but tend to let our guests enjoy the space as they like.

name: Charming Victorian Retreat in Cambridge
description:
Welcome to our newly remodeled Victorian home!
- Traditional soapstone counters and luxury Japanese soaking tub
- Two bedrooms with queen-sized beds and workspace options
- High-end inflatable airbed available for extra guests
- Beautifully gardened yard for relaxation
- Off-street parking space available
- Steps from gourmet grocery stores and restaurants
- Close to Harvard University and Cambridge Historical Society
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled up to Harvard and surrounds the neighborhood is quiet, well established, and beautiful with a lot of history and many famous residents past and current.

Located in the neighborhood of Cambridge called Huron Village, the home is blocks away from the historic Longfellow house, Harvard, MIT, Radcliffe, Leslie and the entire area exudes Victorian charm.

There is easy and quick access to local stores, tree lines streets, and it offers exceptionally easy access to all things Cambridge and Boston, no car required!
host_about:
I love anything with a story behind it.

In Phoenix, we offer a perfect sanctuary near the city's attractions.

In Cambridge/Boston, we care for a 124-year-old Victorian with New England charm, preserving its classic features and greening where possible. 

We share these homes, using earnings to renovate further. We hope you love them as much as we do!

We also help owners share their special homes with others.

neighborhood_overview:

- Typically more cost-effective than booking two hotel rooms
- More spacious than a standard hotel room, providing guests room to relax
- Savings of $35/night with an included parking space
- Fully equipped kitchen for preparing meals and storing snacks, saving dining out costs
- Authentic city-living experience in a residential neighborhood

Your considerations of 17 Traymore are valued. However, please note this apartment may not suit if you intend to host guests. Review house rules before booking.

name: Big 2 bedroom, steps to Davis Sq
description:
Spacious, sunny 2 bedroom, 6 room 1st floor of two-family, private entrance.
7-minute walk to Davis Sq & T-station, 1 min to Mass Ave bus. Queen and twin bed, Ful furnshd din rm, livrm, kit, washer/dryer.

neighborhood_overview:
North Cambridge ( NoCa) is a wonderful quiet neighborhood, and Hollis is one of the nicest streets in NoCa! It is a one way street, and traffic on the street is pretty light. Massachusetts ave is just abut 100 yards up, and within a 5 minute walk you will find many fine restaurants ( two sushi, one Greek, one Italian, one Vietnamese- French, one steak house, one Chinese), a produce market, a dry cleaner, and three banks. There is a CVS in Porter square, about a 10 minute walk on Mass Avenue, and the MINUTE CLINIC there is open 8am- 7 pm.
Additionally, at the end of Rindge Avenue end of Hollis, you will find branch of the Cambridge Public Library, and great play ground with both toddler and "big kid" sections, ball fields, and tennis courts.
And if you are looking for more night life, Davis Square, with a huge variety of restaurants, bars, gift shops, and hipsters, is about a 7 minute walk.

name: Single family house / Cambridgeport
description: A charming single family home in walking distance to MIT/Harvard and a stone's throw from Boston. 2000 sq feet, big enclosed yard with outdoor patio with gas fire-pit and grill, and trampoline. Five bedroom, 21/2 bath, living & family rooms, refinished basement w/play space and laundry in unit. Central Air. Driveway fits 2 cars (and has bball hoop). Pets okay. Ask about dates if not listed. Additional guests are possible. Family friendly: games and bikes are available for use.
neighborhood_overview: In our Cambridgeport neighborhood, you can walk to restaurants, cafes, and shops in Central and Harvard Squares, grocery stores (Whole Foods and Trader Joes), and the Charles River.  Dana Park (with sprinkler and playground) is a block away in this safe and family-friendly neighborhood, rich in diversity and culture.  You can bike into Boston along the Charles, go to the Red Sox, ride the swan boats in the Boston Common, visit the MFA, Aquarium, Science Museum, and much more!
host_about: I am a Middle Grade/Young Adult writer (High) and editor, and I teach at Harvard Summer School and Harvard Extension School.  Check out my website: (Website hidden by Airbnb) for more info.  I love to read, play soccer, swim, hike, bike, watch TV series, go to the beach, and travel when we can.  My husband teaches at Boston University, and we have 4 children.  Our favorite destinations are Martha's Vineyard, NH, Chautauqua, and northern CA.  Our motto: Life is good!

name: Pet Friendly Cozy & Relaxed Near Radcliffe
description:
This pet friendly, raised first floor unit in an historic Harlowe building is the perfect home base to enjoy Cambridge/Boston & all of New England, conduct your research, work from home, teach your course, or just relax in the many public open spaces or our building's quiet private back yard. Sidewalks and roads in this area are always very clear in the winter making it easy to be outdoors.

Condo association requires 3 months minimum. No sort term rentals. 12 month lease preferred.
neighborhood_overview:
Incredible location between Harvard Square, the Law School, the Observatory, and the Charles River.

I love listening to the amazing conversations as I'm out and about, or even sitting in my living room with the windows open. Most of my neighbors are retired professors, researchers, or graduate students. An interesting number of architects as well.

Harvard, MIT and Tufts host fascinating lectures and short courses that are open to the public and feature some of the greatest minds in the world.

The Harvard Observatory is a two minute walk from the flat. They host star gazing events on a regular basis.
host_about: I live in Cambridge, MA and work in higher education.  For fun, I travel and snowboard. I am both an Airbnb host and a frequent traveler.

name: Smack dab between Harvard+Porter 2
description:
The room has a double bed and is on the third floor, cozy and quiet, among the tree tops. At night you have the stars, and by day the room is light and sunny.

The room has wide, old pine board flooring, a sky light with a room-darkening shade, mini-split, closet, dresser, large desk with office supplies, yoga mat, full length mirror, and a fan.

This bedroom shares a full bathroom with the other third floor bedroom which is also rented through Airbnb.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is very special in that it is quiet, you can hear birdsong most times of the day, there are lovely gardens all around. And you will be just 3 blocks from Massachusetts Avenue (Mass Ave), the busiest street in Boston/Cambridge. Or, if you are here in winter, the quiet of the cold air is lovely too, and if we are lucky, you'll see snow!

Along Mass Ave, you can walk to many local run businesses of every sort: gift shops (Joie de Vivre, Nomad, Abodeon, Tokai), coffee shops (Simons, Hi-Rise, Starbucks) and so many restaurants of every ethnicity (Indian, Japanese, Thai, Italian, Mexican, American). You can take a walk from here to the Charles River, through Harvard Square. You can stroll down Mass Ave to Central Square where there is a whole new world waiting for you, but just as Cambridge as any other place! Somerville is just minutes away too (Davis Square, Inman Square, Union Square), and it is an amazingly rich community for music, food and funky shops
host_about:
Hello!  
I'm Connie, a visual artist and a musician. I love living in Cambridge, I've been here for 40 years. I live in a quiet neighborhood, close to Massachusetts Avenue There are many restaurants and lots of things to see and do near by, and Boston is just over the river. 
I love having Airbnb guests. I consider it a rich community. The world comes to my door! 
I hope you will have a wonderful time here in Cambridge while staying at Smack Dab!

Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks. name: Cambridge Single Family with Heated Pool!
description: Rare single family in Cambridge, MA only rented twice a year!  Three levels of historic and chic living: 2700sf.  Family and dog friendly with stunning private, fenced, grassy and professionally landscaped backyard and pool with 6 min walk to T public trans (10 min T or 5-10 min Uber to Harvard; 25m T to downtown Boston). Walk to restaurants of vibrant Porter and Davis Squares or lovely parks.  Quiet, low-traffic street in safe and friendly neighborhood.  Private driveway. "Green" features.
neighborhood_overview: The North Cambridge neighborhood is the hidden gem of Cambridge.  Super-convenient "T" access.  Sports fields, playgrounds and multiple dog parks right around the corner.  Bike trail is about 5 minutes away.  Beautiful Fresh Pond and Danehy Park are very close by.  Many restaurants are within a short walk -- including two of greater Boston's highest rated restaurants (Table at Season to Taste and Urban Hearth).  Great casual restaurants in walking distance too--coffee shop, Mexican, Greek and others.  And then within a 15-20m walk are Davis and Porter Squares, with countless restaurants and bars.  Harvard Square is just slightly further (8 min Uber)  Above all, neighborhood is safe and family-friendly -- really nothing left to be desired!
host_about: Originally from Upstate NY, I am now a Bostonian with 18 years of experience!  I live with my husband, two young boys and one dog in Cambridge, MA and we LOVE it.  We would like to travel more and are looking into ways to make that happen by sharing our homes.

neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. Equally accessible to two of Cambridge's largest green spaces -- Fresh Pond Reservoir and Danehy Park. Close to public transportation (subway & bus) to take you anywhere around Cambridge and Boston. host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Lovely room: walk to  Harvard Square with parking
description: It's a short walk to Central and Harvard Square. The room is lovely and quiet with high ceilings, two windows, wood floors, and a comfortable queen sized bed. There is a bureau, two chairs, and mirrors. The full bath is shared with myself and my daughter. There is a closet with hangers for your clothing and two of the bureau drawers are empty and available for you. There is an electric kettle, tea and water in your room as well as a few snacks. Your towels are in a basket in your closet.
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood has a tantalizing group of eclectic restaurants of all kinds and many places to have coffee. I have a guest book with menus and maps. The famous Plough and Stars pub is on the corner of Mass Ave and Hancock and they have live music most evenings. Improv Boston is just a few blocks away in Central Square. You can take the train downtown to Park Street to find the nearest theater, or go the Kendall Cinema in Kendall Square.
We are within walking distance of the beautiful recently renovated Harvard Art Museum as well as the Peabody Natural History Museum. If you love bookstores the Harvard Bookstore on Mass Ave is a treat as well as the tiny Grolier Bookstore which has only poetry, a Cambridge classic.
The Lizard Lounge just outside of Harvard Square is well known for its poetry slams on Sunday nights. Passim in Harvard Square is another local favorite if you want to hear folk music. The ART theater has two locations, one in Harvard Square for their main theatr
host_about: I am an actress and improv performer, teacher, writer, mother and dog lover. I love yoga and improv and  I am a vegetarian. I spqeak French relatively fluently and I love to travel. I practice meditation qqand I believe in the connectedness of all living beings.

neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and Cambridge is our home. We have a two family house in North Cambridge that was built in 1926. My husband, Gerry, and I live in the upstairs apartment and our first floor apartment is available for short and long-term guests. 

We also have a 3 bedroom cottage a few steps from Nantucket Sound in Harwich Port Cape Cod.  Sometimes we rent our cottage to guests in the summer months.

neighborhood_overview: We are on a quiet tree lined street steps away from the main Harvard campus and about a 10 minute walk to the train stop in Harvard Square. We are also close to grocery stores, parks, the library and a number of other amenities to make you feel at home.
host_about: My family and I are excited to share our family home with you. Work has relocated us, so, instead of renting our home to a regular tenant we want to share it's unique character, architecture and warmth with the Airbnb world.

name: Cambridge Bed and Bath
description:
Lovely bedroom and full private bath in my home on quiet residential street, cozy, private, lots of natural light, or block the light with shades. Super comfortable bed. You may use the kitchen and dining area. Shops and restaurants nearby. 5 to 10-minute walk to Porter Square subway station, 20-minute walk or 5-minute subway ride to Harvard Square. Bluebikes bike share station 1-minute walk away.

I ask that guests be fully vaccinated against COVID. Thank you.
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is quiet and safe, and also close to all kinds of stores and restaurants, and the subway.  It's a 5-10 minute walk to Porter Square and a 20 minute walk to Harvard Square.  A Bluebikes bike share station is a 1-minute walk away; you can unlock a bike and return it to the same station or any other station in the system.

name: Sunny, spacious 2BR w/roof deck near Harvard and T
description: Steps away from public transport (subway, bus, bikes) in a lovely historic neighborhood!  Our guest suite is on the 3rd floor of our elegant home in Porter Square.  You’ll have the entire floor: 2 bedrooms, private bath and private roof deck; we will share the entrance and stairway.  We are surrounded by restaurants and shopping, and, as natives, have lots of tips!  Microwave, fridge and coffee/tea in the suite.  We speak German, French and some Arabic.
neighborhood_overview:
Lively, very safe neighborhood full of restaurants, shops, galleries and playgrounds. Harvard Yard and the Harvard museums and arts venues are nearby, as are Lesley , MIT and Tufts. Nearby Davis Square is a delight!
There are so many colleges in walking, bus and subway range that we are a popular two-bedroom choice for families' college visiting and graduations, for visiting academics and artists, and of course we love to welcome tourists to our beautiful native city!
host_about: I am a Chaplain and Religion/Philosophy Teacher, married with three children and a grandchild.  My husband and I are semi-retired, relaxed and friendly, well-traveled and always respectful of where we are staying.  We are experienced Airbnb hosts, always happy to meet new guests!

description: Design & sophistication in Kendall Square. Near MIT, innovative restaurants with all types of cuisine, shopping centers, and the proximity to the Kendall/MIT metro make this apartment your perfect HQ to explore Cambridge and Boston. Enjoy the panoramic views from your home, its spacious floor plan, the designer kitchen, and oversized windows and closets. This community near the Charles River offers a modern fitness center, concierge services, a Zen garden, a lush clubhouse, and a sundeck.
neighborhood_overview: Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus. Continue the knowledge tour at the Harvard University campus, where you’ll find peace and relax in its beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. Just across the Charles River you will be in downtown Boston surrounded by its gorgeous Revolution-era architecture and historic landmarks. name: 3BR/3BA | 3 Parking | by Central Sq, Harvard & MIT
description:
Step into the comfort of this delightful & spacious 3BR/3Bath condo in the very heart of Cambridge. A spacious & relaxing retreat in a prime location just a few mins from Harvard, MIT, Boston Downtown and walkable to many restaurants, bars, cafes, shops, the T and attractions.

✔ 3 Comfortable Bedrooms each with own private bathroom
✔ Fully Equipped Kitchen
✔ Smart TVs
✔ Workspaces
✔ High-Speed Wi-Fi (500 mbps)
✔ Washer/Dryer
✔ 3x Parking Spots

All amenities are provided for your comfort.
neighborhood_overview:
The condo is nestled in a safe and friendly neighborhood in the heart of Cambridge, MA. This prime and well-connected location, with a Walk Score of 98, offers everything you need within walking distance.

One of the main draws of Cambridge is its world-renowned universities, including Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Take a guided tour of these campuses to learn about their history, see their beautiful architecture, or explore independently.

Beyond the universities, Cambridge has several excellent museums and cultural institutions. For example, the Harvard Museum of Natural History features exhibits on everything from dinosaurs to gemstones, while the MIT Museum showcases the latest advances in science and technology. The Harvard Art Museums are a must-visit for art lovers, with collections ranging from ancient Greek pottery to contemporary paintings.

In addition to its academic and cultural offerings, Cambridge is

Hello there and thank you for visiting my host profile!

I am a Real Estate professional living and working in Cambridge and have been an active host since 2010. 

I am passionate about traveling and love to meet new people of all cultures and backgrounds. I’m originally from Taiwan and enjoy playing music.

Feel free to book or message me first; I am more than happy to answer any specific questions you may have!

name: 2 bedroom-fast reliable wifi, 5 min walk to T stop
description:
Sun-filled 2 bedrooms apartment on the second floor in a quiet residential area with comfortable Queen and Full size beds, Fully equipped kitchen, spacious living room and designated working space with reliable, fast wifi. Ideal place for a family trip.
Only 5 minute walk from red line subway station (Alewife stop). Free parking. Easy access to Harvard, MIT, Boston. Walking distance to Fresh Pond, Porter and Davis Sq for shopping, restaurants, clubs and cinema.

name: sunny 2-level apt. near Harvard
description:
This cozy, sun-filled, family and pet-friendly apartment is in a Victorian house on a lovely, tree-lined street; 5 blocks to Harvard, 3 blocks to Lesley; close to Tufts. Four blocks to Red Line T station and easy access to downtown Boston, hospitals, MIT. One block to Mass. Ave with great restaurants, coffee houses, shops, bars.
Kitchenette, office area, large bedroom with skylights, reading nook, free wireless, cable, Netflix.
Off-street parking, and use of laundry and yard.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is on a quiet tree-lined residential one-way street with attractive gardens, but 1 block from Mass. Ave, with lots of wonderful, varied restaurants, shops, coffee houses, and night clubs. It's a lively neighborhood. There are three markets within 4 blocks.
Great area for walking. Harvard and Lesley Universities, university life and grounds (Harvard Yard), museums, historic buildings, entertainment, are short walks away.
Medical facilities close by.
host_about:
My husband and I have lived in this house over 40 years.  We love our neighborhood and community.  We have two sons and 3 grandchildren - who live in New York City.
I am a sociologist, and have worked in employment and education research and program/policy development.  I am retired, on Board of community-based non-profit assisting low income young people of color build their futures.
I continue  to be involved in political and social policy development.  I like theater, dance, walking with our dog, and visiting with our grandkids, continuous learning, and traveling to interesting places.
My husband and I try to be great hosts - helpful but not intrusive.

name: 3Bdr with parking in West Cambridge
description: Take a walk around Fresh Pond Reservoir, exercise in Danehy Park, shop at Whole Foods and Trader Joe's. A mile and a half from Harvard with a private parking place, this apartment is a perfect base for your short term visit.
neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. Equally accessible to two of Cambridge's largest green spaces -- Fresh Pond Reservoir and Danehy Park. Close to public transportation (subway & bus) to take you anywhere around Cambridge and Boston. For the adventurous, ride along the Minuteman Bikeway from Alewife out to historic Lexington and Bedford.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Big, Bright, Private Room w Bath in luxury condo
description:
This really is an amazing place! The condo is beautiful and has a fully stocked kitchen, dining and living room. You'll have a spacious sunny bedroom w/tv and your own private full bath. Add-ons: free gym, use of w/d & office equipment.

I'd love to have you stay in my home. I live here with 2 fabulous, friendly cats who love guests. Please do not book this room if you don't like cats, are afraid of them, or are allergic to them. I look forward to meeting you! Ciao!!!
neighborhood_overview: This is a beautiful location in Cambridge. You’re just a few steps away from the scenic Charles River and its running and bike paths.  There’s a Whole Foods, a Trader Joe’s, a drugstore, 3 restaurants and a Microcenter (computer and office supplies) on this block, and Sculler’s Jazz Club is right across the river, a 10 minute walk in heels... and did I mention that the best lobster sandwich in Boston is just a block away.
host_about:
I’m an award- winning designer, singer and cook.  And, I'm open to people of all stripes... or polka dots, or color, or gender, or sexual preference. 
I'm a Jersey girl who came to Cambridge as a grad student and never left...  so I can help with local history, lore and information, dining and entertainment suggestions... and if I don’t know something, I know someone who does... and I can guide you to the best lobster sandwich in Boston, just a block away, courtesy of my friends Louie and Mario... and I love meeting new people, like you!

name: Urban Oasis near MIT & Harvard
description:
Newly renovated upscale one bedroom private apartment on first floor in a Central Square Cambridge 2 family house. Walk 10 minutes to MIT or 20 minutes to Harvard or take the T and be in Harvard Square in 2 minutes or Boston in 4 minutes.

Highest speed internet Gigabit x2
neighborhood_overview: We love Central Square for it's rich weave of diversity and culture, restaurants and nightlife, education and the creative and whimsical local merchants!
host_about: My name is Carolyn and my husband, Bill, and I can greet you when you arrive. We also provide a contactless check-in / stay option. Starting in 2010, we spent 3 years working with an architect, lighting designer, contractor and landscape designer to re-envision our home and to create an apartment on our first floor. Our home, our apartment and the garden have turned out to be delightful retreats in the middle of a bustling city environment.

name: Spacious Strawberry Hill Suite (West Cambridge)
description:
This 3rd floor suite is less than 2 miles west of Harvard Sq. You'll have exclusive access to the space, which has a full bathroom and kitchenette.

There is a queen bed suitable for two people and the couch in the living room converts to a bed for one.

Our neighborhood is friendly, safe, and has a lot to offer. Public transportation (bus) is a 5 minute walk. The trip to Harvard Square is 10-15 minutes.

I live in the home downstairs and am available should you need me during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in Strawberry Hill, the smallest neighborhood in Cambridge, and very close to the borders of Watertown and Belmont, Mass. The house is approximately 2 miles west of Harvard Sq., which is easy to get to via public transportation. We’re also near Fresh Pond (about a 10-minute walk) which has lovely trails for walking, running, biking and more.

This listing faces a cemetery, which is very common in this area but worth noting. The cemeteries in this area are well maintained parks. specifically Mount Auburn Cemetery which offers tours.
host_about:
Welcome to my childhood home!

My favorite thing to do on weekends is try new restaurants in Boston and Cambridge. Let me know if you want suggestions!

I try to go to as many live shows as I can. My favorite venues are: Roadrunner and the Sinclair.

Favorite travel destinations: Stockholm; Erfurt, Germany; Mauritius; Porto, Portugal.

Currently binge-ing on: RuPaul's Drag Rae and any show where they restore an old house.

There are many eateries, entertainment venues and sites to visit via walking or taking public transportation. The MBTA bus system is located just outside the door. Also, Uber, Zip Car, Lyft and Hubway Bike rentals are all accessible in Inman Square.
Boston's oldest, continuously operating improvisational theater troupe, ImprovBoston is located just around the corner on Prospect Street in nearby Central Square. ImprovBoston alumni include Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me! panelist Adam Felber.
Studio200 is in a convenient location with lots to see and do with its' many world class museums, colleges and restaurants. Visit Boston's little Italy, Chinatown or the theatre district where you can take in a movie or live play at the famous Wang Centre. See the Blue Man Group.

name: Modern 1BR | Kitchen | W/D | on Charles River bank
description: Design & sophistication in Kendall Square. Near MIT, innovative restaurants with all types of cuisine, shopping centers, and the proximity to the Kendall/MIT metro make this apartment your perfect HQ to explore Cambridge and Boston. Enjoy the panoramic views from your home, its spacious floor plan, the designer kitchen, and oversized windows and closets. This community near the Charles River offers a modern fitness center, concierge services, a Zen garden, a lush clubhouse, and a sundeck.
neighborhood_overview: Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. Take a few steps down the street and wander around the renowned Massachusetts Institute of Technology campus. Continue the knowledge tour at the Harvard University campus, where you’ll find peace and relax in its beautiful gardens and historic buildings. Unwind at the Charles River banks and enjoy the fantastic Boston views, where many trails and bike paths offer a haven to enjoy nature and a healthy lifestyle. name: Convenience, Cozy, and Free Parking
description:
Due to severe allergies that my spouse has, we are UNABLE to host any animals on our property as we share a central AC/heating.

Furnished basement STUDIO- cozy, comfortable, and luxurious place- historic neighborhood with peace.

Private laundry in the unit-kitchenette, Hi-speed Internet - free parking on street
3/4 min walking to MBTA bus lines 71,74and 75
20 -/+ mins walking to Harvard Square
Walking dist to Hospitals, supermarkets, restaurants, cafes, Fresh Pond Lake and Mount A. Cemetery
neighborhood_overview: Our place is in an historic, green and peaceful neighborhood of Cambridge.
host_about:
I am a an entrepreneur in fashion and urban designer. 

My spouse is a biotech entrepreneur. We have two little precious children, two active but cute kids. My spouse, our kids, and I have traveled in the North, South, and Central America, Europe, Middle East, and Asia so far. We love to discover different cultures and meet people from these beautiful, lovely, and nice societies. 

We would be very much happy to host you in our lovely, warm, and friendly place which is disinfected and cleaned properly all the time. Please feel free to interact with us, share your experience, tell us your stories and be part of "the moment" that could give all of us a different point of view about each other, our wonderful planet, and life! 

We tend to give privacy to our guests, so feel free to let us know if you would like to get in touch in person. We are more than happy to say hi in person. 

You are more than welcome to be part of our neighborhood by following CDC's health requirements due to the COVID-19 pandemic, respectfully!

CambridgeSide Galleria Mall  0.6 miles  Massachusetts Institute of Technology  0.4 miles  Harvard University  1.9 miles  Harvard Museum of Natural History  2.2 miles  Cambridge Common 2.5 miles

Yos and the Bluebird Suites team

name: private studio near Harvard/MIT
description: My place has everything you need for a comfortable, easy stay in Cambridge: a  keyless entry to a completely separate studio space allows you to arrive anytime after 3,  so no worries if you arrive on the late side. You''ll find a queen sized bed, microwave/fridge/coffeemaker,  streaming TV, comfortable recliner and a desk chair for when you're working.  We're walking distance from Kendal, Central, and Harvard Squares.  On street parking in our neighborhood using our visitor pass, upon request.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood has a mix of younger professionals, families, and students. We're right next to a city park, 5 minutes from Central Square, and walking distance from Harvard Square and Kendal Square. Central Square has a big collection of restaurants, from alternative vegetarian to Indian, Chinese, the best sushi restaurant in Cambridge, and many more.
host_about: When I travel, I want to feel comfortable and at home wherever I'm visiting, as much like I"m living there as possible.  That's what we've created here: a comfortable little home smack in the middle of Cambridge, 5 minutes from the MBTA subway system, and a lovely walk to Harvard in one direction and MIT/Kendal Square in the other.

This is a great place that is close to everything. It is on the top floor of a three unit building in which you can see the edges of the Boston skyline in the distance.

This place has a comfortable bed, couch, and fully functional Roku TV.

You can get to the Kendall Square T stop within a 10 minute walk and there is plenty to eat and shop for at the Cambridgeside Galleria which is only 3 blocks away.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is the real value of this unit. It is close to the Red line and Green line, both of which will get you anywhere you want to go in Boston or Cambridge within just 15 minutes on the train. And each of these lines is only a 10 minute walk away.

Also, you'll have access to a large mall with plenty of shopping and food options available for you at the Cambridgeside Galleria.

name: Cambridge Comfort - pet friendly, yard and parking
description:
Update: Seeking short term, but with longer term ideal.

My place is a warm, spacious condo with 10 ft high ceilings and mostly hardwood floors throughout. Eat in kitchen with full laundry, dining room/study, and living room. 1.5 bathrooms. Near shopping and entertainment, and public transportation. Free off-street parking, rear deck and yard, and front porch. The room is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. It is also possible to bring a pet (message me if interested).
neighborhood_overview:
My place is in North Cambridge and more residential. It's along the border with Somerville and close to Arlington. Century(s) old classic "Double/Triple Deckers" are common and young or youngish professionals, students and young families live in the mostly renovated homes.

Though quiet, its location is very close free live music nightly in Davis or Porter squares, and probably over 50 restaurants within walking distance.

name: Spacious 2BR 2 bath, walk to Harvard & MIT
description: Welcome! This home is spacious and airy, with high ceilings and open floor plan.  Charming, historic house with all modern amenities: central A/C, stainless steel appliances, Wi-fi, and washer/dryer in unit. Complimentary coffee & tea. Quiet, residential street, yet close to everything: 10 min walk to Harvard,  20-30 min walk to MIT, bus or T (subway) to Boston (25 min). WholeFoods, restaurants, and shops around the corner, with lots more within 5-15 mins walk. Parking by arrangement.
neighborhood_overview: We're on a  tree-lined, quiet, residential street with brick sidewalks and charming 100-year old wood houses, but walking distance to everything. Around the corner are several restaurants and cafés: Dali's (tapas), Kebob factory (Indian), Bergamot (American / fusion), The Thirsty Scholar Pub, Darwin's (sandwiches and baked goods - yum!) and the Biscuit (bakery and café). If you want to eat in,  get stuff around the corner at Wholefoods, The Wine and Cheese Cask, and Savenor's the butcher. A short walk away are lots more shops, restaurants and night life in Inman Square (5min), Harvard Square (10-15 min) and Union Square (5-10min). Harvard Art Museums 10 min, public library and pool 3-5 min walk.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Kjersti, (yup, unusual name unless you're Norwegian - so I also answer to Kirsti or just K:).  I love to travel to places a bit off the beaten path. Closer to home I enjoy my kids, skiing, hiking, biking, Kung Fu, cooking, and spending time with  family and friends.  Looking forward to hearing from you! 
Best, 
Kjersti

name: A floor all to yourself in our historic home
description: Your own floor in our historic Cambridge row house. Originally built in 1846, the third level is recently renovated with a bedroom, bathroom, study and lots of natural light. Just steps from Kendall Square, Red Line, and Green Line. Perfect for a couple visiting for the weekend or a solo work traveler.
neighborhood_overview: This is a hidden gem. Located right next to the city courthouse, our cozy neighborhood is full of tiny treasures and bits of history. Walk around to see beautiful old brownstones, lush courtyards, and the site of the very first house built in Cambridge (the king gave the land to the man who surveyed Charlestown for the crown). You'll also find lots of great restaurants, cafés, bars, and shopping nearby.
host_about: I'm a designer living and working in Boston for the past 10 years, first for The Boston Globe and then Upstatement, a digital design firm. My wife and I love to travel and have both been an active Couchsurfers and AirBNB users (as both host and guest) for years.

description:
A cozy comfortable unique spot with a super-soft mattress that makes you feel like you are in a cloud.

Easy access to a subway, supermarket, local indy cinema, a pool hall, great food, MIT, Harvard, Central Square, the list goes on... Here for work? You are right next to Kendall Square! On-street parking permit available at $5/day.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a unique blend of corporate, academic, and artistic.  You are next to a great food, a park, a pool hall, and way too many places to list ranging from foodie to Toscanini's ice cream (a landmark) to Flat Top (pool hall) to Kendall Square [indy] Theatre, and so on...  Easy access to MIT, Harvard and the plethora of corporations, while right across the river from downtown Boston (Massachusetts General Hospital, Beacon Hill, etc.).
host_about: I've been living in Cambridge/Boston since 2007, at which time I came here for a startup.  Now I run a surgical video journal based out of downtown Boston.  Really enjoy traveling, meeting new people, and sharing stories and experiences.

name: Harvard Square -  free permitted on street parking
description:
WE NOW HAVE VERY FAST INTERNET SERVICE!
Located in Harvard Square, minutes away from HARVARD ,HARVARD LAW, and HARVARD BUSINESS SCHOOL The two bedroom home has two large living rooms with books and original art. An easy walk to reach two excellent cafe's or visit the Harvard Art Museum to see a Van Gogh or Cezanne or have a fabulous meal. *Also, this apartment is not owned by an investment firm or controlled by a property management company.
neighborhood_overview: Mount Auburn Street is a tree lined street with an eclectic array of local gardens lining the sidewalk.  The neighborhood is part of the Half Crown Marsh Conservation District with mostly Victorian architecture    The house is four doors away from Longfellow Park - designed by Charles Elliot in 1887.  Across the street is Riverbend Park where you can sit on a bench and watch the Charles River where rowing teams from the various universities often practice.  We have two cafes in the neighborhood. Darwins and Flour both very good and both close. Memorial Drive which runs alongside the Charles River ( a short block from our house) is closed for biking, roller skating etc. from 11am to 7pm on Sundays from the last Sunday in April until the 2nd Sunday in November.  Because of major universities located in Cambridge, the city is very international and you will hear many different languages spoken
