name: Amazing room near Harvard/MIT/BU, with free bikes
description:
This cozy spot is located in a quiet residential neighborhood a few blocks from Charles River & its bike paths, and near public transportation (47 & 64 buses, Red Line and Green Line trains), major universities, hip restaurants, and grocery stores.

Bikes (of various sizes) with helmets & locks are available during your stay.
neighborhood_overview: Cambridgeport neighborhood: cozy nook with tall leafy trees and Victorian homes, tucked between Mass Ave & the Charles River
host_about:
I'm a software dev who has lived in Cambridge for many years & love all my town offers

Happy to offer local recommendations:
bike trails, kayaking & other outdoor activities (especially nature outings — the Charles River is 3 blocks away!), whale watching, comedy, museums, cultural events

You're also welcome to use my fleet of renovated bikes for exploring, free of charge

I’m always reachable for anything that will make your stay comfortable

description:
Our place is close to MIT, Harvard, Landmark Theaters Kendall Square Cinema, public transport, supermarket, and a lot more...

This room is great for couples, solo adventurers, academics/scholars, business travelers, researchers, and anyone with wanderlust.

With a desk and a monitor to get some work done!

You are next to a great food, a park, a pool hall, and way too many places to list ranging from foodie to Toscanini's ice cream (a landmark) to Flat Top (pool hall) to Kendall Square [indy] Theatre, and so on... name: Sunny 1 bedroom condo close to Harvard/MIT
description:
Quiet and cozy one bedroom condo close to Harvard, MIT, and Inman Square! Recently renovated in a historic Victorian building, it features an updated kitchen and bathrooms, in-unit washer/dryer, and all of the comforts of home. We hope you can use our place as a launching pad for exploring Boston and Cambridge!

There is not parking available as part of this listing.
neighborhood_overview: Inman Square is convenient to everything! Just a 10 minute walk to Central Square where there's lots of shopping and restaurants, plus easy access to the MBTA red line stop at Central Square. Just a block or two away from the apartment are tons of restaurants and coffee shops, making it easy to try all of the delicious cuisine in the area! We are also located in between two Whole Foods, and just two blocks away from a Walgreens. We love living here because it's so easy to get around. Central Square is a 10 minute walk, Harvard and MIT both take about 20-25 minutes to walk, or there are a number of bus lines running all over Boston just a block away!
host_about:
Hi! We are Steph and Ken. We love being active and trying new things. Some of our favorite things are the performing arts, working out, the beach, Disney trips, and meeting new people. Travel is awesome and I've been to Thailand, Laos, Vietnam, London, Paris, Berlin, Sydney, Bali and a few other fun places.

We are clean and respectful, and will treat your home like our own.

A comfortable room with a desk, a bed, a closet. Super comfortable and clean.

Easy access to a subway, supermarket, local indy cinema, a pool hall, great food, MIT, Harvard, Central Square, the list goes on... Here for work? You are right next to Kendall Square! name: Grad Student or Professor!
description:
Great room for a semester stay; more months possible after the first month goes well. Artistic, sunny, close to colleges and subway. Room is quiet and private; a peaceful, clean spot to land w Sealy Posturpedic Full bed. Tree-lined street near Davis, Porter, Alewife. Walk to Harvard, Tufts & Lesley or take subway or bus. Great pup who needs GENTLE pets! Must LOVE rescue dogs!
No lock on door
No kitchen; some use of microwave/fridge
Will share parking tips; no garage or driveway.
neighborhood_overview: Fantastic Cambridge neighborhood! Near all public transportation, very short walk to Davis, Porter, Alewife and about a 20-25 minute walk to Harvard University or Tufts. Lesley is even closer. Parks, bike-path, Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, shops, music bars, restaurants are all within walking distance. The court is quiet and friendly.
host_about: Friendly, politically progressive, resourceful... I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the area well for a native NY'er. You will find the environment 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as one  guest from put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

name: Sunny, quiet, large Cambridge apt near Davis Sq

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is on the second floor of a multi-family home and is located minutes away to Davis Sq in a quiet, safe tree-lined street off the beaten path. Pemberton Farms, a popular local grocery store and numerous fantastic restaurants and cafés are in the area. Movie Theater, live music venues and shops - all in walking distance. Red line subway and convenient buses to Harvard, Tufts, MIT etc bike path and Danehy park close by. Children's playground just down the road.

description:
Have a memorable stay at this spacious and renovated townhouse that will serve as your urban oasis. Four bedrooms are provided for up to eight people to enjoy a good night sleep. neighborhood_overview:
Riverside is a residential neighborhood located along the Charles River, which includes some of the oldest settled parts of Cambridge. Harvard Square and Central Square, both major commercial and transit centers, lie at either end of the neighborhood. Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail. Smaller commercial areas exist along Putnam Avenue, Western Avenue and River Street.
Whole Foods (with wine and beer) is a 5-minute walk; the Charles River (with walking and biking paths) is a 3-minute walk.
This is a diverse and convenient neighborhood.

name: Casa Paradiso - Top Floor 1bed/1bath in Cambridge
description:
Welcome to my Cambridge home with the vibe of Havana! I'd love to share my sunny, professionally-designed 1 bed/1 bath with you. Please treat it with kind and respect, as I would for you and yours.

With a walking score of 93, we're in a bustling neighborhood of great restaurants, coffee shops, craft beer pubs, and supermarkets. You can access Boston from Lechmere (Green), or Harvard Sq via the 69 bus, or bike/walk to Kendall Sq and Central Sq (Red).
neighborhood_overview:
+Across the street is the public library, which I love to go and read or do work
+Right outside is a Little Free Library book exchange. It's an adorable place where you can take and leave books. Feel free to grab some or leave some!
+A few doors down is a bakery with the most amazing Portuguese bread I have ever tasted. I get some once a week.
+A few blocks down is a local butcher shop where I get fresh eggs and meats. If there are some in the fridge during your stay, you're more than welcome to them!
+There's a park and community pool across the street, which is fun in the summers to watch people play softball, or sit on the grass and read a book
+One of my favorite places to eat is Puritan & Company, which serves a modern twist to traditional New England cuisine
+If you're craving Tacos, there is a fab spot called the Lone Star Taco Bar. 4.5 stars, almost 900 reviews. Just saying.
+Usually known for their live music, or just a casual drink at a lo

name: Cambridge Executive Suites
description:
A modern, comfortable, sun-lit Executive Suite with all the necessary amenities for a business traveller.

The 550 sq. ft. suite includes a kitchen with appliances, utensils and supplies. A comfortable bedroom, with a charming view over Linear Park, bathroom and equipped work/lounge space.

The suite is well connected; just a 5 min. walk from the vibrant Davis Square. It's ideal for Guests visiting Tufts/Harvard/MIT for example. Any destination in metropolitan Boston can be reached in 25 mins.
neighborhood_overview:
The suite is located in North Cambridge, near the hip and vibrant Davis Square, Somerville, just a 5 min. walk away along Linear Park. Linear Park is a charming well lit pathway that is well trafficked day and night by folks day and night, walking back and forth to Davis Square, often with street music performers at points along the way.

Davis Square is certainly a cultural location, with shows and movies to see at the Somerville Theatre, in addition to Somerville Open Studios, ArtBeat, HONK! to name but a few of the many festivals the occur in the town around the year.

Davis Square is also a dining destination. There's something for everyone in these blocks, from barbecue to vegan fare. One can find the cuisines of Mexico, Italy, China, India, Japan, and more. And there are new places to find delicious food opening all the time.

And for nightlife, there are no shortage of bars, from the casual to the hip and trendy with fine beverages and food on offer
host_about:
I am part of a three person team. I have an two adorable children, Amber and Aiden.

I am the founder of a real estate tech company, and previously worked as a Structural Engineer on the design of skyscrapers.

I love to travel when I can, and have already visited many countries. But there are plenty of places left to explore, and enjoy again.

I am principally on airbnb to host. But who knows, on my next vacation I may also stay at someone's airbnb in an exotic location.

name: Serene, Roomy 2BR near Harvard & Davis Sq
description:
Enjoy the peaceful tree views from this tastefully furnished, sun-splashed apt in Cambridge! Located on a quiet cul-de-sac, this peaceful 2nd floor apt is a short walk from vibrant shopping centers Porter Sq and Davis Sq (1 subway stop from Harvard Sq). Driveway parking for 1-2 cars avail for extra $100/mo.

STAYS OF 30+ NIGHTS ONLY. NO TAXES FOR 32+ DAY STAYS
neighborhood_overview:
Porter Square area is a happening neighborhood with plenty of restaurants, bars, shops, and grocery stores. Our apartment is a short walk to the Porter Sq subway stop on the Red Line. Harvard Square can be reached in 10 minutes by train (1 stop), or 20 minutes by foot past the colorful shops of Massachusetts Ave. Stay on the train past Harvard and arrive in downtown Boston in 10 minutes or so. Enjoy the beautiful views of the Charles River along the way!

Nearby Porter Square offers a variety of shops including a supermarket, drug store, toy shop, a gift shop that sells wares made by local artists, and a well-visited independent book store (with great coffee!) that frequently hosts talks by notable authors. There's even a new Target a short walk away. Within 2 blocks of the house there are 2 fantastic, highly rated restaurants (Cuban, French), an eclectic neighborhood restaurant/bar, and right at the end of the street is a beloved sports bar that's been in the neighborhood fo
host_about: Hi, I'm Cheryl. I love dancing, playing violin, challenging myself, and trying new things with friends. (Boston is a great place for trying new things!) I meditate regularly and try to live every day according to my values.

name: 3Bdr Spacious Apartment near Fresh Pond
description: Take a walk around Fresh Pond Reservoir, exercise in Danehy Park, shop at Whole Foods and Trader Joe's. A mile and a half from Harvard with a private parking place, this apartment is a perfect base for your short or long term visit.
neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. Equally accessible to two of Cambridge's largest green spaces -- Fresh Pond Reservoir and Danehy Park. Close to public transportation (subway & bus) to take you anywhere around Cambridge and Boston. For the adventurous, ride along the Minuteman Bikeway from Alewife out to historic Lexington and Bedford.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

We are located in the residential neighborhood of North Cambridge, an 8 minute walk from Davis Sq Red Line train station, and 3 minute walk to buses that will take you to Harvard Sq. There are various restaurants and cafes within walking distance, and we will be happy to give you more suggestions if you are looking for things to do in the area. We look forward to hosting you!
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, safe neighborhood nearby Davis Square and Harvard Square.  Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, available for delivery & take out. 8 minute walk to Davis Square (MBTA Red Line Stop) will bring you to a bustling neighborhood with nightlife, a variety of bars/restaurants, movie theater, and boutiques.

name: BnB! Sunny private bedroom/bath near Harvard
description: A private bedroom and private bath in a BoHo style condo  located in Huron Village, a quiet, safe neighborhood in Cambridge.  A continental breakfast is included. Harvard University, Harvard Square and access to public transport (the T)  are only a  15 minute walk along beautiful historic Brattle Street. A diversity of nearby restaurants, cafes, museums, pubs, shops and music and art experiences abound.  Boston is an easy T ride away.
neighborhood_overview: If you are going to visit Cambridge or Boston, this is a great place to stay. Huron Village is a quiet neighborhood full of families, walkers, runners and bicyclists. Its safe to walk here both day and night.  You can stop for a great dinner in Harvard Square and then enjoy a leisurely walk back to Huron Village along historic Brattle street.
host_about: I am a retired science teacher and school administrator.  When I travel, I love to go on  walking holidays. Walking allows me to pay more attention to the landscape and the surrounding architecture, which I love the most.   My favorite walking holiday so far has been through Cornwall, England.  No matter where I go, I always try to seek out some good jazz - especially Latin jazz! The small local music venues are often the best.   I have always been  curious about people, who they are, where they are from and what are their life stories. I look forward to lots of interesting conversations as both a host and a guest.

name: Urban oasis in Huron Village
description: The best of all possible worlds! Bright and airy  cathedral-ceilinged two-bedroom unit  in leafy and lovely Huron Village, across the street from Fresh Pond Reservoir trails, Blue Bikes docking station, and great nine-hole golf course. Walk, bike, drive, bus, or T to Harvard Square.  Great bakeries  and food from cheap eats to high end  in easy walking distance.  Additional guests can be accommodated for a  $50/night charge. Mass. STR certificate C0107520491.
neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is the best of all possible worlds: leafy, lovely, and quiet, it has all the urban amenities.  Fresh Pond Reservoir's  2 1/2 mile walking/running trail is right across the street, with a Blue Bikes docking station.  Within a half mile radius are three bakeries, a Whole Foods and a Trader Joe's and a dozen specialty food stores, not to mention foods from around the world for eat-in or take-out.  Don't miss E.H. Chocolatier.  From spring to Autumn, Formaggio hosts a Saturday afternoon outdoor barbecue, with fried chicken, ribs, and all the fixings.

name: Cultural District, MIT, Harvard, Free parking
description:
Stay here and be in town next to MIT and Harvard.

Whole 1 Bedroom apartment with new King size bed, 1 full bath, Leather sleeper sofa. New Kitchen, A/C, in-unit W/D, gas fireplace. On the edge of MIT's campus. In the heart of Central Square's Cultural District.

You will have access to whole apartment.

Welcome to Cambridge! We look forward to hosting you and your family and friends.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is a Cultural District that is home to diversity, and world renowned universities. There are lots of events in the arts, music, and science. It is the epicenter of the tech hub, walking distance to innovation sector, biotech, research, pharma labs.
host_about:
I love to travel, cook and meet new people. A longtime Cambridge resident, and attentive host who provides the highest standards for my guests. I’m an actual local resident who lives onsite, versus a corporate airbnb listing. You will have a personal connection, and immediate response to your needs if you book with me. I’m happy to give you recommendations for things to see, eat, and do in this great city.  
Look forward to meeting you!
-Dan

neighborhood_overview: We are a recently retired couple from MIT. description:
The perfect Cambridge base: a bright 2-bedroom first floor apartment on a quiet residential street steps from Porter Square’s Red Line, shops, and restaurants.

Reach Harvard Square or Davis Square in one T stop—or enjoy a pleasant 20-minute walk in either direction.

Downtown Boston is about 20 minutes via Red Line or by car from Porter. A street-parking permit for one car is included.

The apartment is very conveniently located near Porter Square, featuring many shops and restaurants nearby. There is an amazing convenience store just a block away.
This is a beautiful neighborhood, very typical of Cambridge. It is a pleasant walk from the apartment to Harvard Square, allowing one to explore the area.

name: Your own private bed, bath, and office/bonus room!
description:
Like Harvard Square's hipper little cousin, Davis Square is famous for its art festivals, restaurants, and live music performances.

This bright, private room is a perfect home base for visiting scholars, or for exploring the city. Located on a leafy side street lined with historic Victorian homes, a short 3-min walk will take you to Davis' lively center. From there, take the Red Line directly to Harvard, MIT, or Downtown Boston. Tufts is a short 20 min walk or 7 min bus ride away. Come explore!
host_about:
I love traveling and meeting new people. Some of my favorite destinations I've traveled to recently are Thailand, Switzerland, Italy, and France. Next up, Japan!

I've lived in Cambridge/Somerville for 10 years now-- first as a student, and now as a software engineer-- so if you have any questions about the area, just ask!

name: Beautiful room in Cambridge , Ma
description: Beautiful private room with a comfy queen bed... Shared bathroom  ( only if the other room is rented at the time if not its all yours)!  Great location- perfect for travel nurses, doctors, professionals.
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridge is a city in Massachusetts, across the Charles River from Boston! Its home to Harvard University. At the heart of campus, grassy Harvard Yard is anchored by the neoclassical Windner Library. Harvard Square has cafes, bars and book stores!
South East is the prestigious Massachusetts Institute of Technology ( MIT)
host_about:
Hello!

Thanks for checking out my properties!  

My name is Dawn and I have been living in beautiful historical Charlestown for the last 16 years. My property is near and dear to my heart as this was my grandparents home that I pretty much grew up in and that I bought after they passed away. I recently decided to turn my beautiful peice of property into a place where visitors can come and enjoy all this wonderful city has to offer while staying in a place of history vs a hotel!  You will enjoy staying here and all this city has to offer_ I will make sure of it!  :) 
 
Thank you and I look forward to meeting you!  

Dawn

name: Charming, spacious gem in heart of City
description: Amazing location with this 1st floor airy and serene, fully furnished apartment in a two family, historic, recently renovated Greek Revival row-house with a private entrance.  Located in a quiet, family-friendly location close to the Charles River, Kendall Square, Cambrideside Mall, Kendall Theater, Harvard Square, MIT, groceries, cafes, restaurants and more. Close to red line (Kendall), green line (Lechmere) and multiple convenient bus lines as well as a quick drive from Logan Airport.
neighborhood_overview: East Cambridge is a vibrant community with many local restaurants, several art venues, a theater and places to explore. The gorgeous Charles river is two blocks from our house with the neighboring Cambridgeside mall. Kendall square is a short walk and Harvard Square is within a stone's throw.  If you would like more information or suggestions let us know and we'll offer some of the locals' best Cambridge places to explore. We want you to have the best possible time while you're here!

name: Light filled lofty layout and all yours!
description: Full of light and open space with room to cook, relax, watch movies or do yoga! Private deck for when the weather is nice. If you have more people I do have a blow mattress that can sleep 2 more!
neighborhood_overview: Cambridgeport is a wonderful neighborhood right in the heart of the city and a short bridge ride or walk across the Charles River from Boston. Early mornings there are lots of runners and in the evening many people are out walking their dogs. All that said this is a city and you should not walk around with headphones on not paying attention to your surroundings especially at night. Please always be alert!

name: Blueground | Kendall Sq, gym, nr mit
description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cheery Kendall Square furnished studio apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and exquisite living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS42)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.

name: Pretty private garden-level condo+parking near MIT
description:
Walking distance of MIT/Central/Tech Square and a number of nice cafes and bars in the heart of Cambridge.
+ Recently finished modern apartment;
+ Self-checkin with a smartlock;
+ Private apartment exclusively yours;
+ Private off-street entrance;
+ On-street parking permit included;
+ Work- and laptop-friendly spaces;
+ Sparkling clean with new appliances and fixtures.
neighborhood_overview:
Walk friendly: Walking distance (12-20 mins) to MIT, Kendall square, and east and mid Cambridge. A longer walk (~1.4 mi) or short Uber/Lyft/city bus ride to Harvard.

Runner friendly: Warm up with a walk/run ~1 mile to get to the Charles river, and then run a loop taking one bridge across the river to Boston and another back to create a 3 mile or 4 mile loop (depending on the bridge), and then cool down another ~1 mile to get back home. Except the bridges, Cambridge/Boston is really flat, perfect for easy jogs.

Groceries: Multiple Whole Foods locations within ~0.6 to ~0.8 miles; Star Market ~0.6 miles away; H Mart ~0.9 miles away.
host_about: Scientist, traveler, coffee lover, fitness freak, host, and an optimist with perhaps an irrational faith in humanity.

name: Stunning urban hideaway nearby Harvard Square
description: Charming apartment in a 19th century Victorian house conserves its period architectural details in recently renovated comfort. Light streams into this en-suite guest residence through gracious windows. Beautiful cabinetry and bookcases offer some evening reading. Enjoy the marble bathroom and hardware floors and well-appointed kitchenette. A stone's throw from Porter Square, where bars, cafes, boutiques, and transportation options abound. Minutes to Harvard,  MIT and Boston.
neighborhood_overview:
Historic, posh Avon Hill neighborhood is great for walking. This part of Cambridge in general has an abundance of old Victorian homes over several square miles. The Cooper-Frost-Austin house (1681), oldest in Cambridge, is just down the street. Raymond Park and playground is nearby as well. The Harvard campus is a short distance away, and in addition to the famous yard proposes the Natural History Museum and its renowned Art Museum. Historic Cambridge Common, where General Washington's troops assembled, is nearby as well. The Porter Square subway stop is a 3-minute walk, and one stop away from Davis square or Harvard Square.

For shopping an errands, we recommend:

Porter Square Post Office
Porter Square Book store
Caffe Nero
Cafe Bourbon
The Abbey (bistro)
Bagelsaurus bakery
The Toad (cozy live music bar)
Christopher's (bistro and sports bar)
Colette Wine Bar and Restaurant
Yume Wo Katare ramen bar
Lunder Arts Cen
host_about: Marie and Andrew have been living in Cambridge for nearly twenty years. Marie grew up in the romantic city of Paris, and is now a filmmaker, script writer, and university instructor. She also loves to cook and read. Andrew hails from the south, moved to Paris to study architecture, and now runs a design and visualization practice in Cambridge. Andrew and Marie love to travel and strike up unexpected friendships.

name: (1) N. Cambridge Private Bedroom Full Bed
description: This bedroom (1 full bed) features beautiful natural light, a lounging chair, and a walk-in closet. We are located in the residential neighborhood of North Cambridge, an 8 minute walk from the Davis Square Red Line train station, and a 3 minute walk to buses that will take you to Harvard & Central Sq. There are various restaurants and cafes within walking distance, and we will be happy to give you more suggestions if you are looking for things to do in the area. Looking forward to hosting you!
neighborhood_overview: This is a pleasant residential neighborhood, an easy 8 minute walk to bustling Davis Square (Tufts University), where you can take the Red Line to Harvard Square, MIT, and into Boston. There are also plenty of restaurants and cafes within walking distance, as well as the Minuteman Bike Path and Fresh Pond Reservation if you feel like enjoying an outdoor stroll.

description: Located in Porter Square Cambridge, you are minutes from most of Cambridge including Harvard, Lesley, and Tufts. Restaurants, stores and subway all within a few blocks of your front door. Or visit downtown Boston just 15 minutes by subway or taxi.

description:
Simple studio apartment w/ kitchen, in-unit laundry, direct access parking, full bathroom, queen bed, couch, tv w/ fire stick, high speed internet, A/C, big windows facing back yard, and more. The space is ideal for 1-2 people but we can offer a blow up mattress for a child upon request.

Our home is on a quiet side street but only one block from Massachusetts Ave with many restaurants and shops just around the corner. 10-15 minute walk to both Harvard and Porter Squares and Red line T stops.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is great!  Our home is on a quiet side street but steps from all you could need.  Around the corner is a starbucks, local coffee shops, high end restaurants, casual restaurants, bars, live music, ice cream, pizza, pharmacy, parks, etc.  All literally within a 3-5 minute walk.  Walking 10-15 minutes is harvard square in one direction and porter square in the other.  We are across the street from Harvard Law School and Lesley University and a 10 minute walk to Harvard Yard.  The red line Train runs right through Harvard and Porter which will bring you to downtown Boston in less than 30 minutes.
host_about:
My husband and I are working professionals with two children and have lived in the Boston/Cambridge area for over 10 years.  We love to visit local parks, dine out, and be tourists in our own city, especially when friends/family come to visit.  There is so much to do and see, we'd be happy to provide recommendations!

We also love to travel as a family.  When we look for an airbnb, our focus is on clean, convenient, and affordable.  That's what we aim to provide for our guests, a place where you feel clean and comfortable and have all the conveniences we can provide.  At our home you will have your own laundry, direct access parking spot, high speed internet, a big TV with smart features, air conditioning, and a compact but fully functional kitchen.  If you travel anything like us, we think you'll be very happy and we look forward to being your host!

name: Upstairs in Central Square
description: Welcome to Upstairs in Central Square! This is two bedroom apartment in the heart of Cambridge.  With an extra fold out futon bed for extra guests.  Great light on this third floor walk up that's set back a block from Mass Ave, so its surprisingly quiet.  Located right in between MIT and Harvard, in the bustling and fun Central Square, the T is a mere 30 second walk away to whisk you away to all parts Boston in minutes!
host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: The NERDpartment in the heart of Cambridge
description:
Our lovely apartment was former worker's housing built during the late 1880s for the labor force nearby the railway to Boston. Located in the heart of East Cambridge, we're 15 minutes walk from MIT/Kendall and Bunker Hill, and 25 minutes walk from Harvard.

With the disappearance of the railways and the rise of high-tech, most of our tenants, including yours truly, have been academics and students of the many universities nearby!
neighborhood_overview:
We have a series of lovely Portugese, Brazilian and Italian restaurants near by Cambridge street. Elmendorf Bakery and cafe, is right around the corner, and 9Zaab Thai place is less than a minute walk!

Along with the popular Lone Star Taco Bar, easy going pizza place of Aram's #2, and cozy bar/restaurant of Portuglia.

Other than food, we are in a highly walkable family neighbourhood with plenty of parks and between two large local libraries. Very close to a nearby Starmarket, and a strip mall. There's also a laundromat less than 30 seconds walk from our door to make up for our lack of laundry options in unit.
host_about: Hello! I'm a explorer at heart and love to see the world, really looking forward to hearing about your experiences and perspectives!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Residents of Cambridge enjoy being in the Greater Boston area without the hustle and bustle of Boston proper, creating the perfect balance between urban living and a suburban feel. Students attending college and living in the area hail from all over the world, giving Cambridge a worldly, international flavor. Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. Kendall Square and Central Square are within walking distance of Boston, just over the Charles River.

name: Spacious apt, 1400 sq ft - 2BR/1BA in Inman Square
description:
Spacious, 2nd floor apartment, excellent natural light, with 3-4 bedrooms (2 furnished), 1 full bathroom, living room, eat-in kitchen, sun-room/porch, and shared backyard space. Laundry is available free of charge in basement. Kitchen is well-stocked. Wonderful location in heart of Inman Square (near plenty of restaurants and bars) and walking distance to Union, Kendall, and Central squares. Wifi included.
Water pressure in shower is weak, but otherwise, very comfortable, spacious apartment.
host_about:
I am an Internal Medicine physician who works in Boston. I enjoy reading, playing tennis, and spending time with friends to relax.
I look forward to meeting many of you AirBnB'ers on my travels, both for work and for pleasure.

description:
Welcome to our home!

You're 1 block from the T and about a 10 minute walk from Harvard Sq, and even closer to all that Davis Square has to offer.

It's a big space for 2-4 adults, plus our kids’ room with a crib and toddler bed if you're traveling with little ones. We have a fully stocked, newly renovated kitchen, big open living + dining room, and lots of light coming in from our magically private backyard.

Please enjoy and treat our home as you would your own.

name: 1 Bedroom Close to MIT/Harvard with Views
description: This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 25 years of experience in the industry. The luxury  building is within walking distance of the MIT and Harvard campuses. The  building boasts amenities such as landscaped grounds, a catering kitchen and dining room,  community garden,  conference room,  resident lounge, fitness center, yoga studio, a grilling area and an outdoor terrace.
neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Residents of Cambridge enjoy being in the Greater Boston area without the hustle and bustle of Boston proper, creating the perfect balance between urban living and a suburban feel. Students attending college and living in the area hail from all over the world, giving Cambridge a worldly, international flavor. Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. Kendall Square and Central Square are within walking distance of Boston, just over the Charles River.

name: Blueground | Central Sq, doorman, nr t stop
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this studio apartment in Central Square with views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this elegantly furnished apartment with its fully equipped kitchen, spacious living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS311)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Private apartment with newly renovated kitchen
description: This spacious garden level 1 bedroom 1 bath guest suite is all yours to enjoy and call home for your visit. Private entrance through a tranquil garden area. neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple Google search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

name: 1 Bedroom near MIT, Panoramic Cambridge Views
description: This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 25 years of experience in the industry. The luxury  building is within walking distance of the MIT and Harvard campuses. The  building boasts amenities such as landscaped grounds, a catering kitchen and dining room,  community garden,  conference room,  resident lounge, fitness center, yoga studio, a grilling area and an outdoor terrace.
neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Residents of Cambridge enjoy being in the Greater Boston area without the hustle and bustle of Boston proper, creating the perfect balance between urban living and a suburban feel. Students attending college and living in the area hail from all over the world, giving Cambridge a worldly, international flavor. Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. Kendall Square and Central Square are within walking distance of Boston, just over the Charles River.
host_about: Furnished Quarters has been helping people stay different for over 25 years. Driven by a passion for providing reliable short-term housing solutions worldwide, we aim to empower our guests with a seamless experience. Our prime locations in sought-after destinations, 24/7 guest service, expert design, and hand-picked furnishings in every one of our high-quality homes come together to create a simplified but sophisticated stay, every time.

name: (SQ) Large room with private bath in Harvard/MIT
description: This private room is located in the heart of Cambridge in Central Square surrounded by lots of restaurants, bars and transportation. You will enjoy the privacy of your space with your personal fridge in this Victorian-era house. Entry to the unit is through the main floor with a passcode lock.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Spacious Inman Sq Apt mins from MIT/Harvard
description: This clean, spacious apartment with parking is in an amazing location for exploring the Boston area. Within easy walking distance of Harvard and Central Squares & MBTA, it is steps from two major train and bus lines and surrounded by an array of great restaurants. Our family has lived here for generations and the decor reflects our Cambridge roots.  There is room here for the whole family to relax after a busy day of sightseeing and a fully equipped kitchen if you need a break from eating out.
neighborhood_overview: Inman Square is known for its independently operated businesses and its many great restaurants.  Things are bouncing back now that the worst of the pandemic is past.  You can walk to pretty much everything you need, or hop onto a bus or train to get to great colleges and universities, museums, historical sights, and shopping adventures.  We're not far from natural wonders, either.  You can take a ferry to Boston's Harbor Islands, Provincetown, and the National Seashore, you can drive to Thoreau's Walden Pond, or you can walk along the banks of the Charles River.

name: MIT/Kendall Lux 3BR Apartment
description:
This spacious 3-bed apt sleeps up to 8. All three bedrooms have a queen-size bed and feature comfortable mattresses, soft linens, and plenty of closet space. It includes a fully equipped kitchen with modern appliances, and the dining area has a large table that seats up to six people.

The apartment is situated in the heart of Cambridge, close to many of the city's top attractions, universities, and restaurants. Public transportation is easily accessible, with several bus and train stops nearby.
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridge is a city known for its world-renowned universities, cultural diversity, and eclectic dining and shopping options. Whether you're a student, a business traveler, or a tourist looking for a unique and authentic experience, Cambridge has something for everyone.

Just steps from the apartment, you'll find a variety of restaurants, cafes, and bars offering delicious cuisine from around the world. From traditional New England seafood to international delicacies, there's no shortage of dining options to explore.

Cambridge is also home to many of the world's top universities, including Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Take a stroll through the picturesque Harvard Yard or visit the MIT Museum to learn about the city's rich academic history.

For those looking for outdoor activities, Cambridge has several parks and nature reserves to explore. The Charles River Esplanade offers scenic views of the city skyline and is
host_about: I work as an engineer at a tech company. In my free time I love spending time outdoors climbing, hiking, and biking.

name: 800sq ft, 2BR Apartment w/ AC, Laundry, Parking
description:
800 square foot (75 square meter) solar powered, garden level, 2-bedroom apartment in Cambridge with private entrance, central air/heat, walk-in shower, full-size washer and dryer, kitchen, and two smart TVs with apps.

We offer free off-street parking for 1 car and are in walking distance to Davis Square (red-line subway station, restaurants, bars, shops, bowling, and theater).

The owners live upstairs and are happy to answer any questions during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
The location is great for easy access to Harvard and Tufts universities and only 5 subway stops to downtown Boston (a 13 minute ride). Massachusetts Avenue is a block away with numerous restaurants and markets.

Davis Square is a 10 minute walk away and packed with restaurants, shops, cafes, bars, clubs, a theater, bowling alley, and supermarket.

The surrounding streets are primarily residential so it's typically very quiet at night for a city. However, we're still just one block away from tons of amenities.
host_about:
We are a gay couple in our 50's splitting our time between Cambridge, Massachusetts, (Davis Square area) and our summer houses in Provincetown, MA, and near Ogunquit, ME. We rent out all three properties if you're interested in any of our listings

Our interests include travel, architecture, wine, board games and cards games, and dinners out with friends.

We lived in Tokyo, Japan, for two years and that's where we got our start using AirBnB - as hosts and guests. We've also lived in various parts of the United States; including Boston, Cape Cod, and Salem (MA), Roanoke (VA), plus San Francisco and Irvine (CA).

name: Sonder 907 Main | King Room
description: Welcome to 907 Main, a gorgeous brownstone in the heart of historic Central Square. Each space features an airy warmth with large windows and hints of exposed brick. Arriving early? We’ve provided luggage storage in the lobby. When you’re ready to explore, head to Massachusetts Avenue for local boutiques, eclectic restaurants, and buzzing taverns. And no matter where your curiosity leads, it all begins at 907 Main.
neighborhood_overview: The vibrant college town of Cambridge keeps finding ways to charm. Red brick buildings, parks and public spaces, cultural attractions, and an invigorating pace of life give the feel of a buzzing European hotspot, where an eclectic mix of young tech professionals and the lively campus communities of Harvard and MIT spill over into the area’s many restaurants, cosy bars, and craft coffee shops. Sitting along the north bank of the Charles River just a few T stops away from downtown Boston, Cambridge’s leafy, sustainably-minded neighborhoods are bursting with things to see and do for every season.

name: Deluxe Queen at Ginkgo House
description: This sun-filled large bedroom is situated on the second floor our large Victorian-style house. It has four large windows with ample natural light and a view of our lovely ginkgo trees in the front. The room has one queen bed, and two twin beds for a perfect family stay up to four people, two adults and two children. This centrally situated house is only 7 minute walk from the red line subway station, 10 minute walk to Harvard, and a WholeFoods within 5 minute walk.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

We hire professional cleaners to make your room ready for you after the preceding guests leave. We take pride in our "cleanness."

Keyless lock on your private door

name: Blueground | Cambridge, private access to park
description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this beautiful North Cambridge furnished two bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and pretty living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS469)
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Superior Queen 5 min from T
description: This sun-filled private bath guest room is situated on the second floor our large Victorian-style house. It has two large windows with ample natural light and a view of our lovely garden on the side. The room has one full bed, and a full-size sofa bed to fit up to three people. This centrally situated house is only 7 minute walk from the red line subway station, 10 minute walk to Harvard, and a WholeFoods within 5 minute walk.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

name: Family Queen at Ginkgo House
description: Welcome to the Ginkgo House, a Victorian era house built in 1867 with  modern amenities. This is a simply decorated family-style room located on the third floor of the house with private bathroom consist of one queen size bed, two singe beds, a study desk, and a mini fridge. Plenty of lights with three windows and a skylight. Shared common areas include living room, dining room, and kitchen; high speed WiFi.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

Apartment is located in a community referred to as Cambridgeport, the beautiful Charles River sits behind the building and on weekends Memorial Drive is closed off for street festivals, bikers, boating events, etc.

Since so close to many historical landmarks there’s always adventure to be taken. Being in Cambridge your in an amazing position to access many parks & recreational activities, museums, art galleries, The Freedom Trail, science centers, the Aquarium and much more.
host_about:
Friendly warm hearted home...

Better Together is our motto and do unto others as you would like done unto you!!!

name: W Camb 4BR/2.5BA on bike path, yard, pets, light!
description:
Beautiful 4BR/2.5BA on 2nd and 3rd floor in quiet W Cambridge. Two balconies, shared backyard on bike path connecting to Minuteman and Charles.

Gut-renovated 2023. Space, light, and a real-home feeling!

Apt is on a quiet residential street 1/2 block from Fresh Pond, a tranquil, forested 2.5 mile loop around a Cambridge drinking water reservoir.

Your rental is the entire 2nd and 3rd floor of a two-family home. We, the owners, live here and Airbnb it when traveling.
neighborhood_overview:
West Cambridge is all the convenience of Cambridge with... an actual backyard!

Our street is very quiet, mostly families, and minutes from Fresh Pond, a lovely 2.5 mile loop around a reservoir which is off-leash dog friendly.

Minutes from Belmont, Watertown, Cambridge, and Somerville hot spots.

Free, ample street parking.

name: Economy 2 Bed w/ Free Parking in East Cambridge
description:
This is an economy 2 bed, 1 bath with a free parking space available in East Cambridge. This is close to many main destinations including MIT, Kendall Square, Cambridgeside Galleria, and the Charles River.

Unit is in a classic Cambridge home. So it does not have a recently renovated feel. But everything is clean and functional. The unit's best selling point is its central location and that we can provide free parking- a rarity in Cambridge.
neighborhood_overview:
Classic Cambridge neighborhood. Tree lined streets with a mix of old and modern houses. There are multiple nearby parks sprinkled throughout the nearby streets. And you can walk along the Charles River just a few blocks away.

Nearby you'll find plenty of shopping options in with a large grocery store a 10 min walk away. You'll be near the Cambridgeside Galleria with its shops and food options. And Kendall Square and Central Square provide more options to eat at.

neighborhood_overview: Riverside is a residential neighborhood located along the Charles River, which includes some of the oldest settled parts of Cambridge. Harvard Square and Central Square, both major commercial and transit centers, lie at either end of the neighborhood. Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail. Smaller commercial areas exist along Putnam Avenue, Western Avenue and River Street. Much of Harvard University’s student housing is located in Riverside. Riverside is also home to some of Harvard’s academic facilities and the primary academic and administrative facility for Cambridge College Riverside is a neighborhood in Cambridge, Massachusetts with a population of 12,181. Riverside is in Middlesex County and is one of the best places to live in Massachusetts. Living in Riverside offers residents a dense urban feel and most residents rent their homes. In Riverside there are a lot of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and parks. Many young professio
host_about:
Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. Our private rooms, studio, one, two, three & four bedroom apartments and homes have been carefully curated to provide a refuge for work, play or rejuvenation. 
STARS offers flexible term stays in the most desirable areas around Greater Boston, Brookline, Longwood Medical Area, most major universities and Cambridge. Our units are pet friendly and accessible by public transit or order up VIP service for airport transfers, a personal driver or pet and child care. Special request? We’ll gladly check into it. We’d love to host you, just call or email us for best rates and availability. I was born and raised in Greater Boston and work in real estate in Brookline for 17 years and counting.

With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Blueground | Cambridge, gym & in-unit w/d, nr mit
description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this sophisticated Central Square furnished two bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and comfortable living room. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS588)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Prentiss House by Thatch | King Room #2
description: Prentiss House by Thatch is a 20-room boutique hotel nestled between Harvard and Porter Square in an iconic Cambridge neighborhood setting. Built in 1843 and renovated in 2022, the building’s rich architecture is complimented by modern amenities and fresh design, providing an upscale yet laid-back atmosphere. Using state of the art technology, roaming staff and a virtual front desk, most guests enjoy their stay without ever needing assistance from our staff.
neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.
host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

name: Blueground | Kendall Sq, gym & concierge, nr mit
description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this stylish studio Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully equipped Kendall Square home with stunning views over the city. (ID #BOS647)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Prentiss House by Thatch | King Rm #3
description: Prentiss House by Thatch is a 20-room boutique hotel nestled between Harvard and Porter Square in an iconic Cambridge neighborhood setting. Built in 1843 and renovated in 2022, the building's rich architecture is complimented by modern amenities and fresh design, providing an upscale yet laid-back atmosphere. Using state of the art technology, roaming staff and a virtual front desk, most guests enjoy their stay without ever needing assistance from our staff.
neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. name: Upscale One Bedroom in Kendall Square -Near MIT/Ha
description: This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 24 years of experience in the industry. The Watermark is a sleek, contemporary apartment complex with brilliant architecture, luxury amenities and the richness of a vibrant neighborhood,  in the Kendall Square section of Cambridge, MA, just across the Charles River and nearby Boston. Building amenities include concierge service, a fitness center, an outdoor terrace, a sky deck, a resident lounge, a grilling area, a Zen garden, private conference space, and more. The property is just steps from the MIT campus, nearby Harvard, as well as several great restaurants, coffee shops, retail establishments, and 2.5 acres of landscaped open space. Exploring the Cambridge and Boston is a breeze as the Kendall/MIT T station, providing access to the Red Line, is just a 3-minute walk from the property.
neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Residents of Cambridge enjoy being in the Greater Boston area without the hustle and bustle of Boston proper, creating the perfect balance between urban living and a suburban feel. Students attending college and living in the area hail from all over the world, giving Cambridge a worldly, international flavor. Harvard Square boasts historic red brick walkways and tree-lined blocks full of restaurants, shops, museums, entertainment centers and bookstores. The nearby Central Square is teeming with eclectic restaurants, bars, live music venues and small theaters. . Cambridge is an easy commute from downtown Boston via the “T” and the bus. Kendall Square and Central Square are within walking distance of Boston, just over the Charles River.
host_about: Furnished Quarters has been helping people stay different for over 25 years. Driven by a passion for providing reliable short-term housing solutions worldwide, we aim to empower our guests with a seamless experience. Our prime locations in sought-after destinations, 24/7 guest service, expert design, and hand-picked furnishings in every one of our high-quality homes come together to create a simplified but sophisticated stay, every time.

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Porter Square, the epitome of Cambridge charm where safety, tranquility, and convenience converge. Nestled just moments away from Harvard, MIT, and MGH, Porter Square offers a serene residential retreat with easy access to academic excellence and urban excitement. Porter Square's affordability without compromising on quality of life makes it a coveted destination for visiting scholars, young professionals, and grad students alike. Discover the harmonious blend of safety, tranquility, and convenience that awaits in Porter Square.

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Porter Square, the epitome of Cambridge charm where safety, tranquility, and convenience converge. Nestled just moments away from Harvard, MIT, and MGH, Porter Square offers a serene residential retreat with easy access to academic excellence and urban excitement.
