Enjoy the peace of mind that comes with a quiet, residential atmosphere while still being steps away from well-stocked grocery stores and an array of restaurants along the vibrant Mass Ave corridor. Porter Square's affordability without compromising on quality of life makes it a coveted destination for visiting scholars, young professionals, and grad students alike. Discover the harmonious blend of safety, tranquility, and convenience that awaits in Porter Square.

name: Wonderful Cambridge Apt. for Short and Long Stays!
description: Spacious and relaxed, this private, 2-bedroom/5-room apartment is located on the first floor of a classic "triple decker" near Porter and Davis Squares.  The apartment has a full kitchen, living and dining room, and access to a shared laundry room. Surrounded by a native plant garden and mature trees, this is a wonderful base for exploring Cambridge's universities, or for longer, sabbatical stays. Harvard Square is one T stop away, or 10 minute by bike / 25 minutes by foot.
neighborhood_overview: This is a culturally diverse, residential neighborhood in Cambridge — located between Porter Square and Huron Village.  The apartment is a 10 minute walk to the Porter Square T station, and 15 or 25 minutes to Davis or Harvard Squares respectively. There is Blue Bike station a block away at Raymond Park, and quick access to multiple parks and green spaces in West/North Cambridge.
host_about:
I live in Cambridge, MA, with my husband, two cats and a thriving native plant garden. 
I love learning people’s stories, and exloring new places, whether distant or local. 
Our properties  are dear to our family. Two, which I share with my sister,  belonged to our vibrant mother, who was a skilled horsewoman and enlightenment seeker. ✨

neighborhood_overview: Great neighborhood on a green side street in Cambridge. Great amenities with grocery store and restaurants / coffee shop within 5 minutes radius.
host_about:
5 things you can’t live without?
(website hidden)

1. My wonderful wife and kids
2. Vibrant Cambridge
3. Science and Technology
4. Ice cream
5. Day at the beach

We love traveling and we try to do an exotic trip every year. We love the backpacker way of travel. Adapting to our kids we have only switched from taking local busses to rental cars. We really enjoyed Costa Rica, Dominican Republic and Ecuador/Galapagos Islands. In our wild youth we both traveled through Asia. In addition we head to Sweden and Germany once a year to visit family and spend time in a remote summer cottage by the ocean.

We love our home and (little) city garden and we hope that you will like it as well. We expect you to take care of the place as well as we do.

Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Prentiss House by Thatch | Deluxe King #17
description: Prentiss House by Thatch is a 20-room boutique hotel nestled between Harvard and Porter Square in an iconic Cambridge neighborhood setting. Built in 1843 and renovated in 2022, the building's rich architecture is complimented by modern amenities and fresh design, providing an upscale yet laid-back atmosphere. Using state of the art technology, roaming staff and a virtual front desk, most guests enjoy their stay without ever needing assistance from our staff.
neighborhood_overview: The hotel resides on a quiet residential street in the Baldwin neighborhood of central Cambridge. In the summer of 2021, the Baldwin neighborhood was named after black educator, Maria Baldwin who worked hard to represent the importance of racial justice and opportunities for women of color within Cambridge and beyond. To each side of the Baldwin neighborhood, lies Harvard and Porter square with Massachusetts Avenue serving as a connecter of the two. Directly to the east, the neighborhood borders the nearby city of Somerville. Surrounded by top institutions, there’s no shortage of activities, bars, and restaurants to experience during your stay at Prentiss House.
host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

host_about: Thatch is an ever-evolving hospitality management company that specializes in co-living, hotels and apartment-hotels for short and long stays. Founded in 2010, Thatch's goal is to make Boston more accessible by providing innovative housing and hotel concepts at prices and on terms that put the value in hospitality back where it belongs - with the guests. We do this by stripping out non-essential services and amenities - like daily room cleaning and on-site food and beverage - and by centralizing our staff. In exchange, Thatch guests are afforded privacy, independence and more room in their travel budgets. Simple. Flexible. Functional. That's Thatch.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

description: You must love dogs! Bruno, my big, lovable mixed Rottweiler/Pitbull, and his little buddy Leo, an adorable Pomeranian, are part of the package. neighborhood_overview:
There are a few restaurants literally across the street, a bank, high end grocery store Formaggio, and other cute shops.
About one-half mile west of Harvard Square and Fresh Pond is the Observatory Hill neighborhood. Its neighborhood retail and business center is found around the intersection of Concord and Huron Avenues. Further out Huron Avenue towards Fresh Pond is the set of businesses known as Huron Village. Both of these centers offer a variety of neighborhood restaurants, grocery stores, some small offices, and unique retail and specialty shops that serve the surrounding community.
host_about:
I am Democratic political consultant who travels a lot for business and pleasure both domestically and internationally. My homes are showcases for the various art and handicrafts I have picked up along the way.

I have homes in Kigali, Rwanda, Washington, DC and in Cambridge, MA that  I list on AIRBNB and try to use AIRBNB when I travel as well. 

My brother Adam manages the Cambridge house most of the time and will be your primary contact should you choose to stay there. My friend Whinock helps me manage guest communications in Kigali  and we have a full staff to support guests there.

The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Apt in superb Cambridge location
description: Our 3-bedroom, 1 bathroom home is located in the heart of West Cambridge - close to Huron Village, public transportation, Harvard and Porter Square, as well as a short walk to the Charles River.  Walkable to restaurants, local library, coffee shops, clothing stores, many playgrounds and more!! There are hardwood floors throughout the home, generous sized rooms, and a shared backyard for family BBQs or small gatherings.. You would also have access to a parking spot in our driveway.
neighborhood_overview: Located in a wonderfully central area. Easy access to route 2 to head out west, very close to multiple red line stops that can take you into Boston, and walking distance to many stores, restaurants, and community resources (playgrounds, library, public pools, etc). Located right in Huron village, the home is walking distance to delicious Peruvian, Chinese, Nepalese, Italian, and other restaurants, as well as cafes, a rare book store, children’s stores and a number of boutiques, salons, yoga studios, and so much more! It is also walking distance to Fresh Pond Reservoir which provides a beautiful 2+ mile walking/running loop that feels removed from the city life. Trader Joe’s, While Foods, CVS, Apple Cinemas and more are a five minute drive down the road. It’s a wonderful neighborhood where people are friendly and there is lots to do!

name: Charming home & neighborhood near Harvard, Tufts
description: Our 3 bedroom apartment is on the 2nd and 3d  floors of our 2-family home on quiet, pretty Hollis Street, steps from Davis Square (Somerville) and Porter Square (Cambridge), and Harvard Square (Cambridge). which is 1.5 miles away. No car needed - you can walk anywhere or take public transportation.  It's a 5-8 minute walk to the Davis Square subway station where you can take the Red Line to downtown Boston - a 15 minute ride.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle-Eas
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and Cambridge is our home. We have a two family house in North Cambridge that was built in 1926. My husband, Gerry, and I live in the upstairs apartment and our first floor apartment is available for short and long-term guests. 

We also have a 3 bedroom cottage a few steps from Nantucket Sound in Harwich Port Cape Cod.  Sometimes we rent our cottage to guests in the summer months.

name: Blueground | Cambridgeport, w/d & gym, nr mit
description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this lovely one bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully equipped Cambridgeport home. (ID #BOS851)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is in Cambridgeport, a charming neighborhood just west of MIT’s campus. It’s a historic area known for Victorian-era homes and tree-lined streets, where the bordering Charles River adds to the neighborhood’s natural allure. In fact, Magazine Beach offers a scenic riverside escape here, making it perfect for picnics or leisurely strolls. Foodies enjoy an eclectic restaurant scene, with plenty of global cuisine, bakeries, and cocktail bars. This neighborhood perfectly balances the comforts of residential living with the vibrancy of city life. It’s a highly desirable spot just north of Boston. For those taking transportation into or out of the neighborhood, the Kendall/MIT or Central stops on the T are a just a short walk away.

name: Exceptional Modern-Yet-Cozy Cambridge Home
description:
This spacious, light-filled townhouse is an oasis of calm that’s close to everything. Come back from a visit to Harvard or MIT, a walk along the river, the Marathon, or a Sox game and enter a home full of pleasant surprises from museum-quality art to jewelbox bathrooms to a shaded back patio.

Wood, glass, metal, and tile combine to create a modern yet timeless look. The dining room table seats eight, the TV is big, there are plenty of books, and the couches invite naps.
neighborhood_overview:
Cambridgeport is an old residential neighborhood that's close to everything. It's an easy walk from the house to Harvard Yard (23 minutes), MIT's Great Dome (17), the Charles River (12), Fenway Park (35) and the Central Square T stop (8).

The area has everything: iconic live-music venues; speakeasy-ish bars, food from all over the world — even a dispensary ;). There's a kid-friendly park a block away, two of the world's top universities nearby, and serendipity in every direction.

name: Blueground | Central Sq, w/d & gym, nr t station
description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this stylish one bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully equipped Central Square home. (ID #BOS861)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview:
Your Cambridge hub! Located in the residential Cambridge neighborhood of Cambridgeport, the apartment is a five-minute walk from Central Square where you'll find the subway as well as many restaurants and shops. host_about: Hello! I'm Liesl - and yes, my mother was a fan of "The Sound of Music"! Originally from New Jersey, I came to Boston for college and after a couple years living in Europe, I returned to make my home here. I've lived in Fenway, Beacon Hill, the South End and now in Jamaica Plain with my husband and two teenage sons. Many years working in the travel industry gave me a great background for my shift to  hospitality. I love working with travelers and we've had guests from all over the world - so interesting to hear your stories and what brings you to Boston. I would love to host you and give you all the inside info about what makes Boston a great place to visit!

neighborhood_overview:
Somerville is considered to be a highly walkable and bike-able city. Somerville hosts 21 Bluebikes (originally Hubway) stations, one of which is located right in Porter Square (Elm St).

Porter Square is a neighborhood in Cambridge and Somerville, between Harvard and Davis Squares. The Porter Square station has both the MBTA Red Line and the Commuter Rail Fitchburg Line. A major part of the Lesley University campus is located within the Porter Square area. There are also many shops and restaurants. Within the Art Deco-style building located at 1815 Massachusetts Avenue, The "Shops at Porter" have a recent history of being a center for Boston's Japanese community and is home to many Japanese eateries. Nearby, on Mass Ave on the other side of porter square is Yume Wo Katare, a ramen noodle restaurant that shouldn't be missed!

neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood houses one of the best-known high-tech and innovation hubs of the United States and arguably has the highest concentration of PhD's in the world.

However, this neighborhood is probably the most "below the radar" for tourists, but what it lacks in glamour it more than makes up for it in total, earnest hidden-gem-ness. Cruise down its main aorta, Cambridge Street, for access to some of the best fish markets, Portuguese bakeries, and well-loved bars in town. Mall rats can get their fill between the Cambridgeside Galleria and the Twin City Plaza shopping center, but one would be remiss to pass up stylish treasures at the Cambridge Antique Market. The residential makeup is richly diverse,anchored with strong Irish and Portuguese communities. Local pride runs thick.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Porter Square, the epitome of Cambridge charm where safety, tranquility, and convenience converge. Nestled just moments away from Harvard, MIT, and MGH, Porter Square offers a serene residential retreat with easy access to academic excellence and urban excitement. Its central location and seamless access to the Red Line subway ensure effortless exploration of downtown Boston and beyond. Enjoy the peace of mind that comes with a quiet, residential atmosphere while still being steps away from well-stocked grocery stores and an array of restaurants along the vibrant Mass Ave corridor. Porter Square's affordability without compromising on quality of life makes it a coveted destination for visiting scholars, young professionals, and grad students alike. Discover the harmonious blend of safety, tranquility, and convenience that awaits in Porter Square.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships.

Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels.

name: Blueground | Central Sq, in-unit w/d, nr dining
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this two bedroom apartment in Central Square. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this fashionably furnished apartment with its fully equipped kitchen, lovely living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS898)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Blueground | Kendall Sq, gym, w/d & rooftop
description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this pretty studio Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully equipped East Cambridge home. (ID #BOS918)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Sunny’s Place
description: We welcome you to enjoy the sights and sounds of the city with us! Your Family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located apartment. Easy access to both Harvard & Tufts Universities, a 5 minute walk to both the subway (Alewife Station-Red Line) and local bus routes. You will have your own apartment on the first floor of our 2 family home, with a private entrance and back deck.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a residential neighborhood, with a playground and nearby dog park. A public swimming pool is a 5 minute walk, or take in a local little league game or the high school soccer and football teams on the nearby ball fields. Fly a kite or run track at nearby Danehy Field. Take in a round of golf at the public course. Access to a 13 mile bike path is 2 minutes away.

You are in walking distance to multiple restaurants and quick access to downtown Boston, Harvard Square and Kendall Square (M.I.T.)
host_about:
Hello. Our home is a typical New England 2 family house located in North Cambridge. The Airbnb occupies the 1st floor and we live on the upper 2 floors. We are within easy walking distance to both bus and subway transportation as well as restaurants. Gail and I are both retired lawyers and enjoy meeting our guests from around the world. 
We hope that you will enjoy staying with us.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.

name: Harvard, MIT, Central Square Art
description:
Quirky, spacious, unique, bohemian space near Harvard and MIT, Central Square.

Easy walk to transit hub (Red line train, buses), bookstores, tons of restaurants, parks, grocery stores, post office, library, art supply store, pharmacy, parking garage, and more.

This is a shabby chic artist place with character not a flawless hotel. Reflected in price.
host_about: This is a profile I've made for my mother. I work between art, science and technology and spend much of my time in Cambridge, MA, mostly at Harvard and MIT. She is a traveled, sweet, and active professional and excellent host and spends most of her time in California. Either of us may welcome you and are happy to show you around time-permitting, as well as answer any questions you may have about the area and generally be a reference source on your visit. We hail from Mexico City, and collectively have traveled all over Europe, South America, Canada, nearly all of the U.S. states, Japan, China, Thailand, and the Middle East. My mom is a kind and generous person who owned a travel business a while back when we lived in the Yucatan Peninsula, and she looks forward to hosting folks in her gorgeous High Desert home!

name: Blueground | Central Square, gym, nr t station
description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this pretty two bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully equipped Central Square home. (ID #BOS818)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Blueground | Central Sq, fitness, close to dining
description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this charming one bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully equipped Central Square home. (ID #BOS993)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS991)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description:
One (1) private bedroom with double bed, private bath and private kitchenette in our renovated 1860's house on a quiet, tree lined street in Cambridge. Separate dedicated entrance for the exclusive use of our guests. Short walk to Red Line T-stop, Charles River, neighborhood parks and great local coffee shops and restaurants. Only one mile to Harvard, MIT or BU.

Free visitor parking permit available upon request.

neighborhood_overview:
One of the most iconic neighborhoods located at the affluent Back Bay destination is full of shopping and dining places you must visit, along Newbury Street, all locals frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries, and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses. You can walk a few streets over to Marlborough and Beacon to find peaceful, tree-lined streets where the crowds feel miles away.

Staying in Back Bay means quick access to almost any part of the city, whether it’s crossing the bridge to Cambridge or heading to dinner in the South End. The Green and Orange lines are just steps away, but the ability to walk almost anywhere in the city is the real draw for most residents. Access to cultural institutions like the Boston Public Library and Symphony Hall, as well as iconic green spaces like the Boston Public Garden and Commonwealth Mall is an obvious draw that explains why the area has maintained its desirability all the way from the Victorian era to the pres

name: Blueground | Kendall Sq, gym, nr green line & shop
description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this stylish one bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully equipped Kendall Square home. (ID #BOS1010)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: P22, Cozy Room Near MIT/MGH/Harvard, 30 Days+
description:
Enjoy easy access to everything from this perfectly located home:
- 10-min walk to MIT;
- 1-min direct T ride to Mass General Hospital;
- 9-min direct bus ride to Harvard main campus;
- 28-min direct T ride to Harvard Medical School; and
- 7-min walk to shopping centers, Apple Store, Starbucks, supermarkets, pharmacies, restaurants, etc.

Please note:
- Shared kitchen and bathrooms.
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood houses one of the best-known high-tech and innovation hubs of the United States and arguably has the highest concentration of PhD's in the world. However, this neighborhood is probably the most "below the radar" for tourists, but what it lacks in glamour it more than makes up for it in total, earnest hidden-gem-ness. Cruise down its main aorta, Cambridge Street, for access to some of the best fish markets, Portuguese bakeries, and well-loved bars in town. Mall rats can get their fill between the Cambridgeside Galleria and the Twin City Plaza shopping center, but one would be remiss to pass up stylish treasures at the Cambridge Antique Market. The residential makeup is richly diverse, anchored with strong Irish and Portuguese communities. Local pride runs thick.

name: Blueground | E Cambridge, gym & w/d, near T stop
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this one bedroom apartment in East Cambridge. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this  furnished apartment with its fully equipped kitchen,  living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS967)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description: Your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located gem. neighborhood_overview: Cambridgeport is rated as one of the best places to live in Massachusetts. This walkable neighborhood offers residents a dense urban feel comprised of university students, young professionals, and lifelong residents. There is no shortage of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, and parks. Harvard Square and Central Square are lively and convenient to the public transportation system. The public schools in Cambridgeport are highly rated.

host_about:
Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. Our private rooms, studio, one, two, three & four bedroom apartments and homes have been carefully curated to provide a refuge for work, play or rejuvenation. 
STARS offers flexible term stays in the most desirable areas around Greater Boston, Brookline, Longwood Medical Area, most major universities and Cambridge. Our units are pet friendly and accessible by public transit or order up VIP service for airport transfers, a personal driver or pet and child care. Special request? We’ll gladly check into it. We’d love to host you, just call or email us for best rates and availability. I was born and raised in Greater Boston and work in real estate in Brookline for 17 years and counting.

description:

name: Blueground | Porter Square 1bd apartment
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this one bedroom apartment in Baldwin. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this airy furnished apartment with its fully equipped kitchen, bright living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS1112)
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

host_about:
Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. Our private rooms, studio, one, two, three & four bedroom apartments and homes have been carefully curated to provide a refuge for work, play or rejuvenation. 
STARS offers flexible term stays in the most desirable areas around Greater Boston, Brookline, Longwood Medical Area, most major universities and Cambridge. Our units are pet friendly and accessible by public transit or order up VIP service for airport transfers, a personal driver or pet and child care. Special request? We’ll gladly check into it. We’d love to host you, just call or email us for best rates and availability. I was born and raised in Greater Boston and work in real estate in Brookline for 17 years and counting.

name: Single family, Harvard University, Red line

Renovated single family home found in this Agassiz-Harvard University neighborhood. The quiet tree lined street is minutes to shopping, restaurants, and public transportation.

Please note: For any stays 28 days and longer an additional cleaning fee of $170 will be charged.
neighborhood_overview:
The Agassiz neighborhood is located in Cambridge, Massachusetts, near Harvard University. It is primarily a residential area known for its charming, tree-lined streets and historic architecture. The neighborhood offers a mix of housing options, including single-family homes, apartments, and condominiums.

Agassiz is known for its close-knit community feel, with neighbors often gathering at local parks or cafes. The neighborhood is also within walking distance of Harvard Square, which offers a wide range of shops, restaurants, and cultural attractions. Overall, Agassiz is a popular choice for students, faculty, and staff of Harvard University, as well as for families and young professionals looking for a vibrant and convenient place to live.
host_about:
Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. Our private rooms, studio, one, two, three & four bedroom apartments and homes have been carefully curated to provide a refuge for work, play or rejuvenation. 
STARS offers flexible term stays in the most desirable areas around Greater Boston, Brookline, Longwood Medical Area, most major universities and Cambridge. Our units are pet friendly and accessible by public transit or order up VIP service for airport transfers, a personal driver or pet and child care. Special request? We’ll gladly check into it. We’d love to host you, just call or email us for best rates and availability. I was born and raised in Greater Boston and work in real estate in Brookline for 17 years and counting.

name: Private 1 BDR Apt in Harvard sq home with A/C
description:
This updated apartment is on the edge of Harvard Square on a very quiet and historic street. The unit has an open floor plan with a private entrance, lots of light through large windows overlooking a private patio area.

The full kitchen has everything you need to cook great meals, including a dishwasher and ample storage space. You are also a few minutes' walk from great restaurants or take-out.

The bathroom is spacious with a bathtub. There is a new laundry machine and open closet space.
host_about: A long time resident of Cambridge, I love living in this culturally diverse city right between some of the best educational institutions in the world.  Everything is a short t or walk away.  Originally from Toronto, Canada I love to travel and have enjoyed the Airbnb experience in other countries.  I am excited to now be a host and share our home with others coming to experience Cambridge.

name: Blueground | Central Sq, gym, nr bars & groceries
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this studio apartment in Central Square. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this  furnished apartment with its fully equipped kitchen,  living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS1062)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this sophisticated two bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully equipped Kendall Square home. (ID #BOS1142)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.

We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. name: Blueground | Central Sq, w/d, nr MIT Museum
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this two bedroom apartment in Central Square. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this  furnished apartment with its fully equipped kitchen,  living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS1152)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Blueground | Kendall Sq, gym, w/d & roof, nr mit
description: Discover the best of Cambridge, with this studio apartment in East Cambridge. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this  furnished apartment with its fully equipped kitchen,  living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (ID #BOS917)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Cozy one-bed in Harvard Square
description: Charming one-bedroom in quaint antique house just off Harvard Square in quiet neighborhood. The bedroom has a comfortable queen bed and a separate storage area. neighborhood_overview:
🌆 Neighborhood Vibes
Stay right in the heart of Downtown Boston’s historic Financial District, where old-world charm meets modern city living. Step outside and you’ll find cobblestone streets lined with beautifully preserved architecture, lively plazas, and some of the city’s most iconic landmarks.

🚶‍♀️ Walkable & Connected
Everything you need is just a short walk away — from the Rose Kennedy Greenway’s parks and paths to the Boston Harbor waterfront. World-famous spots like Faneuil Hall Marketplace, Quincy Market, and the Custom House Tower are nearby, and the neighborhood has excellent public transit connections that make exploring the rest of the city effortless.

🍴 Food, Coffee & Culture
Guests love being surrounded by trendy cafes, world-class restaurants, and local pubs. Whether you’re in the mood for a quick coffee, seafood by the water, or a romantic dinner in a historic setting, you’ll find it just steps away.

✨ Perfect for Every

Book your stay and let’s make this trip unforgettable!

name: Blueground | Central Square, garden, nr Harvard
description: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this stylish Central Square furnished one bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and exquisite living room. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS1176)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Blueground | Cambridgeport, rooftop, nr MIT
description: Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this stylish one bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully equipped Cambridgeport home. (ID #BOS1200)
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is in Cambridgeport, a charming neighborhood just west of MIT’s campus. It’s a historic area known for Victorian-era homes and tree-lined streets, where the bordering Charles River adds to the neighborhood’s natural allure. In fact, Magazine Beach offers a scenic riverside escape here, making it perfect for picnics or leisurely strolls. Foodies enjoy an eclectic restaurant scene, with plenty of global cuisine, bakeries, and cocktail bars. This neighborhood perfectly balances the comforts of residential living with the vibrancy of city life. It’s a highly desirable spot just north of Boston. For those taking transportation into or out of the neighborhood, the Kendall/MIT or Central stops on the T are a just a short walk away.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live. With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description: This is a very small private bedroom, with shared kitchen and 2 shared bathrooms. It is basically just for sleeping for ONE person. The share kitchen on the 2nd floor is stocked with pots, pans, basic seasonings, simple complimentary snacks and cup noodles. No SMOKING anywhere inside/outside the property. The central air system circulates air to all rooms.

description:
**AT THE CENTER OF IT ALL**

Peaceful, cozy retreat just 2 blocks (4-min walk) from Central Square Subway Station (T-Line), with quick access to Boston. name: Harvard Square Haven | Rooftop Deck + Game Room
description:
Currently Furnishing

Stay steps from Harvard Square and Harvard University at this charming retreat. Walk to Harvard, Central and Inman Squares with their cafés, shops, and nightlife. Unwind on the roof deck after exploring Cambridge Common, the Harvard Museums or Toscanini’s ice cream. Hardwood floors, full kitchen, laundry and bright rooms make this home perfect for families, professionals or visitors wanting both comfort and location. Enjoy a true Cambridge experience in the heart of it all.
host_about:
We offer stylish, comfy stays with hotel-quality touches—because you deserve more than just a place to crash. Need local tips? Extra pillows? No problem. Just don’t lock yourself out at 2 AM (but if you do, I’ve got you).

Book your stay and let’s make this trip unforgettable!
